Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Extension of Banking Hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the Period June 4-16, 2025 Relative to the Estate Tax Amnesty Deadline

Details.Details:
In accordance with the provision of the Memorandum of Agreement executed by the Authorized Agent Banks (AABs), Bureau of Internal Revenue and the Bureau of the Treasury, more particularly item 2.1.1 of the bank obligations which states that: HTcADC

"The AAB shall:

1. x x x

2. x x x

2.1.1 To accept ALL tax payments during regular banking hours and to extend banking hours during tax deadlines";

All AABs are hereby advised to accept tax payments and extend banking hours until 5:00 PM starting June 4, 2025 up to June 16, 2025, in view of the anticipated increase in the number of taxpayers in relation to the upcoming Estate Tax Amnesty deadline on June 14, 2025.

This Bank Bulletin is issued to ensure the orderly and efficient receipt of tax payments in connection to the expected surge of transactions related to the said tax amnesty.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Clarifications in the Acceptance of Tax Returns and Its Attachments and Processing of Tax Payments from Taxpayers as Well as the Inclusion of BIR Form No. 1701MS in the Form Codes Table of LBDES/AAB Electronic Payment System

Details.Details:
With the implementation of Republic Act (RA) No. 11976 or the "Ease of Paying Taxes (EOPT) Act" and in relation with Bank Bulletin (BB) Nos. 2024-02 and 2024-05, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised on the following clarifications: aScITE

1. AABs are no longer required to accept and stamp any manually submitted attachments to tax returns from taxpayers.

2. The AABs are allowed to accept manually filed returns and payment of taxes due thereon in cases of unavailability of BIR electronic filing (eFiling) platforms or the tax return is not available in the said eFiling platform which shall be covered by an advisory released/published by the BIR.

3. AAB branches shall advise the taxpayers who are submitting hard copies of attachments to the filed returns that the submission of said attachments shall be made through the Electronic Audited Financial Statement System (eAFS)/eSubmission, whichever is applicable. In case of unavailability of said facilities, the attachments can be submitted manually to the BIR district office that has jurisdiction over the taxpayer.

In addition, with the implementation of Republic Act (RA) No. 11976, also known as the Ease of Paying Taxes (EOPT) Act, relative to the use of new income tax form for taxpayers classified as MICRO or SMALL taxpayers, below is the new tax return and the assigned tax type code for the said tax return:

BIR Form No.

BIR Form Name

Tax Type

1701MS

Annual Income Tax Return
For Individuals Classified as MICRO or SMALL Taxpayers

IT

In line with this, all AABs are advised to accept the manual filing of BIR Form No. 1701MS and to include the said BIR form in the Form Codes Tables of the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/AAB Electronic Payment System. DETACa

Moreover, other existing procedures relative to the acceptance of tax payment and processing of out-of-district returns provided in related Bank Bulletins shall still be observed.

For your information and guidance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

It has come to the attention of the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) that certain branches of Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) have been refusing to accept out-of-district tax payments from taxpayers. ETHIDa

No. 11976, also known as the "Ease of Paying Taxes" Act.

Original Law.To: Submission of Consolidated Report of Daily Collection (CRDC), Report of Returned/Dishonored Checks (BIR Form No. 12.58) and Transmission of Electronic CRDC (.csv file) for Online/ePayment Gateway Channels

Details.Details:
This is in connection with the submission of Consolidated Report of Daily Collection (CRDC) and Report of Returned/Dishonored Checks, as provided in Bank Bulletin Nos. 2009-37, 2010-23 and 2010-41. TIADCc

Relative thereto, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are mandated to:

1. Submit a clear and readable soft copy of the duly signed CRDC in Portable Document Format (PDF) file together with, if there are any deductions from the CRDC, the duly acknowledged BIR Form No. 12.58 with the corresponding dishonored check/s, to Revenue Accounting Division (RAD) via email at rad_bnkrec@bir.gov.ph and to the concerned bank analysts (see ANNEX A) within five (5) calendar days from the date of collection. Failure to submit complete reports will result to the imposition of penalties pursuant to the Memorandum of Agreement with the BIR, BTr, and AAB, under Revenue Regulations No. 2-2008 dated January 10, 2008;

2. Discontinue the submission of hard copies of CRDC and BIR Form No. 12.58 to RAD; and

3. Discontinue the transmission of Electronic CRDC (.csv file) to ecrdc@bir.gov.ph for Online/ePayment gateway channels.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns/Payments of Internal Revenue Taxes by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) on April 5, 2025 and April 12, 2025, Saturdays and Extension of Banking Hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the Period April 1-15, 2025

Details.Details:
In accordance with the provision of the Memorandum of Agreement executed by the AABs, Bureau of Internal Revenue and the Bureau of the Treasury, more particularly item 2.1.2 of the bank obligations which states that: HTcADC

"The AAB shall:

1. x x x

2. x x x

2.1.1 x x x

2.1.2 To open bank operations two (2) Saturdays immediately prior to April 15 of every year and extend banking hours from 3:00 P.M. to 5:00 P.M. from April 1 to income tax payment deadline;"

All AABs are hereby advised to accept tax payments on April 5, 2025 and April 12, 2025, and to extend banking hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the period April 1 to April 15, 2025.

In connection thereto, all accepted income tax payments on April 5, 2025 and April 12, 2025, shall be reported in the Batch Control Sheet (BCS) as collection for the following working day, April 7, 2025 and April 14, 2025, respectively. However, the machine validation of the Annual Income Tax Return (AITR) in the deposit slip for the tax payment received shall be on the date of the actual receipt of collection. The remittance of the tax collections and the submission of the BCS, together with the supporting income tax returns and attachments, shall be in accordance with the existing procedures.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Amendment in the Reports of Returned/Dishonored Checks Received by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs)

Details.Details:
In view of the numerous reports received from the Revenue District Offices (RDOs) of the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) regarding the late reporting of returned/dishonored checks received by the Authorized Agents Banks (AABs), all AABs are hereby reminded/advised on the following amendments imposed in Bank Bulletin No. 2010-23, to wit: DETACa

Item No. 1. The submission of Report of Returned/Dishonored Checks using BIR Form No. 12.58 to the Revenue District Office (RDO) will be one (1) to three (3) banking days upon receipt of said Dishonored Check.

Item 3b.1. The AAB Head Office shall deduct the amount of Dishonored Checks from the current total collection due for remittance within one (1) day from the receipt of Dishonored Check reported by AAB Branch.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) Teller's Guide

Details.Details:
The Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) has come up with an updated BIR-Authorized Agent Bank (AAB) Teller's Guide which includes discussion on the latest processes and procedures brought about by the Ease of Paying Taxes (EOPT) Law and the various revenue issuances. HTcADC

In this connection, all AABs are hereby advised to use the said Teller's Guide which provides uniform guidelines and procedures on the following:

A. Authorized Agent Bank's Roles and Responsibilities

1. Acceptance of Tax Payments Through Over-The-Counter

2. Collection Data Entry to LBDE System

3. Preparation of Reports

4. Remittance of Collection

B. Other BIR Procedures and Processes for Authorized Agent Banks (AABs)

1. Reporting of Returned/Dishonored Check

2. Notes in Stamping or Receiving Annual Income Tax Return and Financial Statements and its Attachments

3. Timely Uploading of Collections and Remittances

4. Resolving the Rejected/Unuploaded BCS-A

5. Common Bank Errors Which are Subject to Penalties That Must be Avoided in the Receiving of Tax Returns/Payment Forms/Declaration

6. A Glimpse of the Memorandum of Agreement Among the Authorized Agent Banks, the Bureau of Internal Revenue and the Bureau of Treasury

In addition, AABs are directed to use the sample AAB signage bearing the new BIR Logo and its specifications as shown in Illustration No. 6: AAB Signage, page 14 of the said Teller's Guide and to be posted in a conspicuous place within the bank branch premises.

Likewise, the soft copy of the AAB Teller's Guide may be requested from the Collection Programs Division through e-mail at cpd@bir.gov.ph.

For your guidance. CAIHTE

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

ATTACHMENT

Authorized Agent Bank Teller's Guide

BACKGROUND

The implementation of Executive Order No. 937, issued on March 1, 1984, through the issuance of Revenue Regulations (RR) No. 5-84 dated May 29, 1984, vesting in the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) the primary responsibility of enforcing the collection of national revenue internal taxes though the Banking System. On January 5, 2024, the Ease of Paying Taxes (EOPT) Act or RA 11976 was signed into law by President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. The act aims to incentivize taxpayer compliance by simplifying procedures and reducing burdens, consequently boosting government revenue collection.

Under the EOPT Act, taxpayers are required to file their tax returns electronically and pay their taxes due thereon through the Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) via Over-The-Counter (OTC) payment, Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS) and other BIR ePayment gateways, such as, but not limited to:

a) Development Bank of the Philippines' (DBP) Pay Tax Online — for holders of Visa/Mastercard; Credit Card and/or BancNet ATM/Debit Card;

b) LandBank of the Philippines (LBP) Link.Bbiz Portal — for taxpayers who have ATM account with LBP and/or holders of BancNet ATM/Debit/Prepaid Card and taxpayer utilizing PCHC PayGate or PESONet facility — for depositors of RCBC, Robinsons Bank, Union Bank, BPI, PSBank and Asia United Bank;

c) Union Bank's Online/The Portal Payment Facility — for taxpayers who have an account with Union Bank of the Philippines or Instapay via UPAY — for individual Non-Union Bank account holders; or

d) Tax Software Provider/Taxpayer Agent — Maya/MyEG.

Moreover, AABs accept tax returns and its corresponding payment due thereon through OTC in accordance with the rules, policies and regulations set-forth in the Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) among the BIR, the Bureau of Treasury (BTr) and the concerned banks, as well as the BIR relevant issuances.

This partnership continues, as the Banks agrees that acceptance of internal revenue taxes through OTC payment is part of their strategy to offer various banking services to their customers and provides additional payment channel option to taxpayers. Though, the BIR and the AAB continues to encourage online tax payments and making its services seamless, AABs still need to have their OTC collecting bank branches open to accept payments for back-up purposes, especially during BIR tax deadlines. aScITE

I. INTRODUCTION

The aim of the AAB Teller's Guide is to provide a reference guide for the bank tellers who are tasked to perform activities that are related to collection as one of the BIR's core functions. Likewise, this guide will make it easier for the bank teller to learn the fundamental and specific duties of the AABs from the acceptance of internal revenue tax returns and tax payments up until the point at which the tax collections are reported and remitted through data entry. All basic information on collection-related processes contains updated policies and processes based on existing revenue issuances.

Serving a guide for our bank tellers will provide a standard implementation of collection functions. Also, this AAB Teller's Guide is expected to be used as an aid in their task performance, resulting in more efficient and successful collection enforcement techniques.

II. DEFINITION OF TERMS

1. Revenue Regulations (RRs) — refers to issuances that specify, prescribe or define rules and regulations for the effective enforcement of the provisions of the National Internal Revenue Code (NIRC) and related statutes.

2. Revenue Memorandum Orders (RMOs) — refers to issuances that provide directives or instructions; prescribe guidelines; and outline processes, operations, activities, workflows, methods and procedures necessary in the implementation of stated policies, goals, objectives, plans and programs of the Bureau in all areas of operations, except auditing.

3. Revenue Memorandum Circulars (RMCs) — refers to issuances that publish pertinent and applicable portions, as well as amplifications, of laws, rules, regulations and precedents issued by the BIR and other agencies/offices.

4. Bank Bulletin — refers to the bank advisories or clarification issued by the BIR that pertains to the collection of internal revenue taxes and receiving of the corresponding tax returns and their attachments which are intended for immediate publication.

5. Authorized Agent Banks (AAB) — refers to a Commercial or Universal Bank authorized by the BIR in accordance with the criteria for accreditation under pertinent revenue issuance to collect internal revenue taxes and receive the corresponding tax returns and its attachments. DETACa

6. Bank Debit System — refers to the system whereby a taxpayer, through a bank debit memo/advice, authorizes withdrawals from its/his/her existing bank account for payment of tax liabilities.

7. Bank Code — refers to the code that the BIR assigns once the bank branch is approved to accept payment of internal revenue taxes.

8. Batch — refers to a set or group of tax returns.

9. Batch by 50's — refers to the copies of tax returns received on a daily basis that are arranged in set by fifties (50's) or group by fifties (50's). These tax returns will be encoded into the Limited Bank Data Entry System per batch of 50's.

10. Batch Control Sheet-A (BCS-A) — refers to the form prepared by the bank branch and RDO, that summarizes collection data from the tax return and deposit/payment slip of taxpayers settled through cash, check, or a combination of both.

11. Bank Teller — refers to a person designated by AAB to accept the filing tax returns, receive its corresponding tax payment, post the tax payment collected and transmit tax collections.

12. BIR-Approved Bank Tellering System — bank system that (a) Captures tax payment data collected by each accredited bank branch; (b) Allows the bank branch to report collection data to BIR data centers through Electronic Data Transmission (EDT); and (c) Allows the AAB head office to summarize its bank branches collections and submit the Consolidated Report of Daily Collections (CDRC).

13. Cash Payment — refers to the payment of tax liabilities in the currencies (paper bills or coins) that are legal tender in the Philippines.

14. Check — refers to the bill of exchange or order instrument drawn on a bank that is payable on demand.

15. Collection Date — refers to the date of payment that was debited to the BIR and BTr clearing account.

16. Due Date — refers to any period prescribed by a Governmental Authority for which a Tax Return is required to be filed and pay the corresponding taxes due thereon.

17. Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS) — refers to the system developed and maintained by the BIR for electronically filing of tax returns, if any, and paying taxes due thereon, specifically though the internet.

18. Electronic Bureau of Internal Revenue Forms (eBIRForms) — refers to the two (2) types of electronic services (e-Services) provided by the Bureau relative to the preparation, generation, and submission of tax returns, which are the following: HEITAD

a) Offline eBIRForms Package; and

b) Online eBIRForms System.

19. Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) — refers to a stand-alone system that: (a) Captures tax payment data collected by each accredited bank branch; (b) Allows the bank branch to report collection data to BIR data centers through Electronic Data Transmission (EDT); and (c) Allows the AAB head office to summarize its bank branches collections and submit the Consolidated Report of Daily Collections (CRDC).

20. Over-The-Counter (OTC) — refers to the manual payment of tax liabilities to AABs.

21. Tax Debit Memo (TDM) — refers to BIR Form No. 2311 duly issued by the Commissioner or his duly authorized representative acknowledging that the taxpayer named therein has duly paid its/his/her internal revenue tax liability through the use of a duly issued and existing Tax Credit Certificate (TCC). The TDM serves as the official receipt from the BIR evidencing a taxpayer's payment or satisfaction of his tax obligation. The amount shown therein shall be charged against and deducted from the credit balance of the aforesaid TCC.

22. Tax Due — refers to any amount required to be paid by the taxpayers.

23. Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) — refers to a unique and identifying number used by the taxpayer for tax purposes.

24. Tax Return — refers to any return, payment form, declaration, report, claim for refund, information return or statement or other document required to be filed with respect to taxes, including any schedule or attachment thereto, and including any amendment thereof.

25. Tax Return Period — refers to the covering period of the tax return.

26.

27. Tax Return Receipt Confirmation (TRRC) — the confirmation of tax return filed online through eBIRForms.

28. Transaction Date — refers to a date of actual filing and payment through OTC.

III. AUTHORIZED AGENT BANK'S ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

A. ACCEPTANCE OF TAX PAYMENTS THROUGH OVER-THE-COUNTER

The AAB Branch shall:

1. Receive from the taxpayers in triplicate copies the printed copies of the electronically filed tax returns together with the proof of filing (Tax Return Receipt Confirmation/Filing Reference Number), necessary attachments thereto, if any, and the BIR-BTr deposit/payment slip, notwithstanding the Revenue District Officer's (RDOs) jurisdiction;

A BIR-BTr deposit/payment slip shall have transaction date, taxpayer's name and Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN), BTr-BIR account number, account name which is BTr-BIR, name of the drawee bank and check number (for check payment), bank debit advice number (for debit system payment), and the amount of tax to be paid. Said deposit/payment slip shall be accomplished and issued in triplicate copies, distributed as follows: aDSIHc

a. Original (taxpayer's copy);

b. Duplicate (AAB's copy); and

c. Triplicate (to be attached to the tax return).

2. Check the completeness of presented tax return, ensuring that the details of the background information are properly filled out as to, among others:

a. Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN)

b. Name of the taxpayer, address, contact number and email address

c. Revenue District Office (RDO) Code

d. Signature of the taxpayer/authorized representative or agent

e. Amount to be paid

3. Check the attached accomplished BIR-BTr deposit/payment slip that all payment-related information indicated by the taxpayer matches those indicated on the tax return prior to acceptance of the same.

4. Stamp "RECEIVED" and "Out-of-District" on the three copies of the tax return and affix the teller's initials and transaction date.

Note:

a. The attachments to the Annual Income Tax Return (AITR) shall be stamped only on the page of the Audit Certificate, Balance Sheet, and the Income Statement. The other pages of the financial statements and its attachments need not be stamped "RECEIVED." In case of corporations and other juridical persons, a maximum of two (2) extra copies of the audited financial statements for filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and other agencies that may require the same should be stamped "RECEIVED." [1]

b. For acceptance of late payments, AABs shall stamp "FILED LATE" on the tax return and "INCREMENTS NOT PAID" if the additional penalties/fees are not paid by the taxpayers. ATICcS

5. Accept tax payment and machine validate the BIR-BTr deposit/payment slip accomplished by the taxpayer as evidence that the tax payment was deposited to the account of the BTr. The machine validation must reflect on the BIR-BTr deposit/payment slip the date of payment, amount paid, transaction number, the name of the bank, branch code, teller's code and teller's initials. [2]

6. Accept out-of-district tax return with payments from taxpayers paying thru checks with different collecting AAB branch name indicated on the face of the check, provided that the payment is made through other branches of the same AAB. However, taxpayers shall indicate at the back of the check the name of the receiving AAB branch. [3]

Moreover, accept check payment even without the name of receiving AAB branch, TIN and name of taxpayer indicated in the face of the check, provided that all check payments shall be made payable to the "Bureau of Internal Revenue" and the AAB shall require the taxpayers to write legibly the name of the receiving branch, TIN and name of taxpayer at the back of the check.

7. On the mode of payment, the following procedures shall be observed: [4]

a. If tax is paid in cash, there is no limit in the amount of cash payment.

b. If tax is paid thru check, the taxpayer shall indicate the following data in the space provided on the check: "PAY TO THE ORDER OF" the accepting or receiving bank branch, FAO (For the Account of) Bureau of Internal Revenue as payee. The check shall contain the Account Name and the Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) of the Taxpayer.

Note: One check shall be drawn for the payment of a single internal revenue tax liability. This means that if a taxpayer has two or more tax liabilities, that is, one income and another for percentage tax, separate checks shall be drawn for each kind of tax.

Illustration No. 1: Where the drawee bank and the accepting/receiving bank are the same. ETHIDa

Illustration No. 2: Where the drawee bank and the accepting/receiving bank are different from each other.

Illustration No. 3: Where the AAB name indicated on the face of the check is different from the accepting/receiving branch of the same AAB, provided the name of the accepting/receiving branch is indicated at the face/back of the check.

Image 3.1 Front Check

Image 3.2 Back Check

Illustration No. 4: Where the taxpayer's name and TIN are not pre-printed on the face; hence, the AAB shall require the taxpayer to type or write them legibly on the face/back of the check. [5] TIADCc

Image 4.1 Front Check

Image 4.2 Back Check

c. If tax is paid thru Cash and Check, two or more checks and/or combination of cash and check/s may be accepted in payment of a single internal revenue tax liability. [6] cSEDTC

d. If tax is paid thru Manager's or Cashier's Check, personal check, the issuing bank shall indicate on the space for "PAY TO THE ORDER OF" the following data: (1) Bank Name-Branch Name (2) FAO Bureau of Internal Revenue as payee and (3) under the "Account Name" the Taxpayer's Name and TIN. [7]

Illustration No. 5: Manager's Check

Option 1. IFO indicated on the face of the Check

Option 2. Name of Taxpayer and TIN at the back of the Check AIDSTE

Image 2.1 Front Check

Image 2.2 Back Check

Note:

In cases where the Taxpayer's name and TIN are not pre-printed on the face of the check, the AAB shall require the Taxpayer to type or write them legibly at the back of the check.

e. If tax is paid thru bank debit system, the taxpayer must have a bank account with the AAB branch where it/he/she intends to file and pay its/his/her tax return.

f. If the tax is paid thru Tax Debit Memo, the TDM number should be indicated on the tax return and BIR/BTR deposit/payment slip. A photocopy of the front and back pages of the Tax Credit Certificate (TCC), the source of the TDM, as well as a copy of the TDM must be attached to the tax return. Note that a TDM is not acceptable as payment for withholding taxes, including the fringe benefit tax, as well as for taxes, fees and charges under special schemes of the BIR as excise tax deposits to cover payment of taxes for future removals of excisable articles. SDAaTC

g. Tax Return with combination of TDM and check or cash payments shall be filed with the AABs or Revenue Collection Officers (RCOs). However, purely TDM payment shall only be filed with the RCOs for which an electronic Acknowledgment Receipt (eAR) shall be issued through the Mobile Revenue Collection Officers System (MRCOS). [8]

Reminder:

The following checks are not acceptable as check payments:

I. Accommodation checks — checks issued or drawn by a party other than the taxpayer making the payment except for the following which shall not be considered accommodation checks for the purpose of and should be accepted in payment for internal revenue taxes:

a) Checks drawn against a joint or multiple account for the purpose of tax payment of the personal tax liability of any of the members thereof provided that the name and TIN of the paying member/s shall be indicated on the back/face of the check;

b) Checks drawn against the personal account of the owner of a single proprietorship in payment of the tax liability of his/her business;

c) Checks drawn against the account of a single proprietorship in payment of the tax liability of the owner provided that the name and TIN of the owner are indicated at the face/back of the check; and

d) Check issued by either of the spouses to pay their income tax liabilities.

II. Second-endorsed checks — checks issued to the taxpayer as payee who indorses the same as payment for taxes. AaCTcI

III. Stale checks — checks dated more than six (6) months prior to presentment to the AAB.

IV. Postdated checks — checks dated a day or several days after the date of presentment to the AAB.

V. Unsigned checks — checks with no signature of the drawer or one (1) or more signature/s of authorized signatory/ies is/are missing.

VI. Checks with alterations/erasures, unless duly counter-signed by signatory himself/herself.

VII. Checks that are not in accordance with the requirements of the Check Image Clearing System (CICS) of the Philippine Clearing House Corporation (PCHC).

8. Release to the taxpayer the duly stamped "RECEIVED" triplicate copy of tax return and the original copy of the machine validated BIR-BTr deposit/payment slip.

9. Post the tax payment collected, using the on-line tellering system, by crediting the BTr demand deposit account in the head office of the AAB.

Further, all AABs are reminded on the following:

1. AAB shall accept the tax payments from taxpayers who are already within the bank's premises by the close of the banking hours.

2. AAB shall accept check payments after the bank clearing cut-off time and stamp the tax return "Received after cut-off/clearing time" or with similar stamp.

3. AAB shall accept the payment of manually filed tax return from taxpayers enrolled in the Bureau's Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS) in case of unavailability of the eFPS facility as announced by the BIR or the unavailability of the eFPS-AAB where the taxpayers are enrolled.

4. AAB shall accept the payment of manually filed tax return including its attachment from taxpayers only in case of unavailability of the eBIRForms.

5. AAB shall not request or maintain any extra copies of taxpayers' tax returns. [9] acEHCD

6. AABs shall notify the BIR on any change of AAB branch name/address/location and/or the merger of AAB branch with other AAB branch in order to update the BIR record/system. [10]

7. AABs shall provide signage to the AAB branches informing the public that said branch is authorized by the BIR to received payment of internal revenue taxes. [11]

2. Encode the tax payment information into the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) or Bank System indicating the RDO Number of the accepting AAB branches in the required field of the LBDES or Bank System, instead of the RDO Number where the taxpayer is registered.

Information details for cash payments shall consist of the date of transaction, name of taxpayer, TIN-Branch Code of taxpayer, form type, tax type, return period, and amount of tax paid. For check payments, name of the drawee bank, check number and issue date shall be included.

Note:

For payment using Form 0605 and 0611-a, ensure that the tax type indicated in the said forms will be selected in the list of valid values in encoding the payment details.

a) Proper Encoding of BIR FORM 1606 — Should be in the name and TIN of the Buyer as indicated in the form as well as in the deposit slip of the taxpayer.

b) Proper encoding of BIR Form 1706 — Should be in the name and TIN of the Seller as indicated in the form as well as in the deposit slip of the taxpayer.

c) Proper encoding of payments through checks. Must be encoded/uploaded as check in the system and not as cash.

3. In cases where the AABs are using their own BIR-approved tellering system in the encoding of payment details and generation of BCS-A, which cannot provide a separate BCS-A for out-of-district tax return, AABs shall manually indicate "Out-of-District" beside the item number of the corresponding tax payment information listed in the BCS-A prior to submission to the concerned Host RDO. HSAcaE

4. Transmit the encoded collection data via Electronic Data Transmission (EDT) to the concerned BIR-RDC within forty-eight (48) hours from the time of collection on regular days and seventy-two (72) hours during tax deadlines, except in transactions which the BIR specifically requires 24-hour transmission (e.g., payment of capital gains tax). [12]

C. PREPARATION OF REPORTS

The AAB Branch shall:

1. Send the daily collection reports to the concerned AAB Head Office for consolidation.

2. Generate Batch Control Sheet-A (BCS-A) in triplicate copies and attach the original and duplicate copies of BCS-A to the physical returns.

3. Coordinate daily with the AAB Head Office or to the concerned RDO for the status of transmitted BCS-A collection file to the concerned BIR-RDC, if rejected or uploaded or with integrity errors.

4. Prepare the BCS-A and its accompanying copies of tax returns and applicable attachments (original and duplicate copies) for retrieval/pick up of the authorized BIR Retriever.

5. Retrieval of BCS-A reports with the accompanying copies of tax returns and applicable attachments (original and duplicate copies) shall be on the day after the allowed period for AABs to transmit the collection report, which is forty-eight (48) hours for regular days and seventy-two (72) hours for tax deadlines.

The AAB Head Office shall:

1. Prepare the Consolidated Report of Daily Collections (CRDC). Under existing policies, AABs transmit the CRDCs through eCRDC facility daily. The signed hardcopies thereof with attached copies of the Authority to Debit the Demand Deposit Account (DDA) of the AABs shall be submitted to RAD on the following Monday after each week. These reports shall serve as basis of the BIR through Revenue Accounting Division (RAD) in revalidating the accuracy/completeness of the uploaded data in the ITS-CBRS/IRIS-Collection, Remittance and Reconciliation System (CRR) of the BIR. [13] AScHCD

2. Submit to BTr a collection report comprising all BIR collections, including adjustments, in Comma Separated Value (.csv) file format, through the Secured File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) folder of BTr-TRAMS not later than 4:00 PM of the succeeding banking day from date of collection. [14]

3. Submit to RAD the reports of Dishonored Checks and adjustments (Supplemental and List of Adjustment) in case there is a need to adjust previously submitted CRDC and then remit the tax collections net of adjustment(s) and dishonored checks.

D. REMITTANCE OF COLLECTION

The AAB Head Office shall:

Remit tax collections to the account of the BTr with the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP), using the "BTr-Treasury Single Account" or "BTr-TSA" not later than 11:30 AM of the succeeding banking day from date of collection through the PhilPaSSplus of the BSP.

The BSP is already implementing the use of the PhilPaSSplus, the system where AABs create payment instructions for the remittance of taxes to the BIR through the BTr.

IV. OTHER BIR PROCEDURES AND PROCESSES FOR AUTHORIZED AGENT BANKS (AABs)

A. REPORTING OF RETURNED/DISHONORED CHECK

The AAB Branch shall:

1. Prepare the Report of Returned/Dishonored Checks (BIR Form No. 12.58) in five (5) copies to be distributed to the following offices: original copy to BIR-Revenue Accounting Division (RAD); duplicate copy to BTr; triplicate copy to AAB Head Office; quadruplicate copy to RDO/LTCED/LTDO and quintuplicate copy for the AAB branch file copy. HESIcT

Illustration 10: Image of Report of Returned/Dishonored Checks

2. Submit to the RDO/LTCED/LTDO the quadruplicate copy of BIR Form No. 12.58, together with the original check, within seven (7) working days from the date of receipt of the returned/dishonored check. Require the RDO to acknowledge in writing the receipt thereof on the four (4) other copies of the said report. Returned/dishonored checks which are not reported within seven (7) working days from the receipt of the returned/dishonored check will no longer be accepted by the RDO. [15]

In case of Out-Of-District dishonored check payment, the accomplished BIR Form No. 12.58 shall be submitted to the RDO/LTCED/LTDO which has jurisdiction over the AAB receiving branch.

3. Submit immediately the BIR Form 12.58 duly acknowledged by the RDO to the AAB Head office. AAB Head Office send electronically the dishonored check details to RAD thru email: ecrdc@bir.gov.ph.

4. File the quintuplicate copy of the report for future reference. AcICHD

The AAB Head Office shall:

1. Receive the duly acknowledged copies of BIR Form No. 12.58 from the AAB branch.

2. Deduct from total remittance the amount of dishonored checks reported by the branches based on BIR Form No. 12.58 duly acknowledged by the RDO/LTCED/LTDO.

3. Attach the copies of the duly acknowledged BIR Form No. 12.58 to the CRDC as follows: original copy of CRDC to the RAD; duplicate copy of the CRDC to the BTr; and retain the triplicate copy thereof for file.

4. Submit the eCRDCs, together with the Report of Dishonored Checks and the duly acknowledged copies of BIR Form No. 12.58, to the RAD.

B. NOTES IN STAMPING OR RECEIVING ANNUAL INCOME TAX RETURN AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND ITS ATTACHMENTS [16]

In receiving the Annual Income Tax Return (AITR) of the taxpayer and its attachment/s:

1. Receive the AITR in three (3) copies, whether or not the taxpayer is under the jurisdiction of a revenue district office.

2. Stamp "RECEIVED" the three (3) copies of AITR.

3. Stamp "RECEIVED" the attached financial statements to the AITR only on the page of the Audit Certificate, Balance Sheet and Income Statement, if any. The other pages of the financial statements and its attachments need not anymore be stamped "RECEIVED."

4. In the case of corporations and other juridical persons covered by BIR Form No. 1702, stamping of "RECEIVED" shall be extended in at least two (2) additional copies of the audited financial statements, aside from those attached in the AITRs, to satisfy the requirements of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

C. TIMELY UPLOADING OF COLLECTIONS AND REMITTANCES

TRANSMISSION OF COLLECTION DATA POLICIES AND PROCEDURES [17]

The transmission of BCS to concerned Revenue Data Centers (RDCs)/National Office Data Center (NODC) through Electronic Data Transmission System (EDTS) shall be within forty-eight (48) hours from the time of collection on regular days and seventy-two (72) hours during deadlines except in transactions which the BIR specifically requires 24-hour transmission (e.g., payment of capital gains tax). [18] caITAC

1. Transmit daily collection data and the "no transaction" report, if there is no transaction/tax payment received for the day, to the concerned Revenue Data Centers (RDCs)/National Office-Data Center (NODC). [19]

2. Inform the concerned RDCs/NODC for all successful and as well as the rejected transmissions of collection data/report. The rejected collection data/report should be communicated within twenty-four (24) hours after the close of the banking day, for resolution.

E. COMMON BANK ERRORS WHICH ARE SUBJECT TO PENALTIES THAT MUST BE AVOIDED IN THE RECEIVING OF TAX RETURNS THAT MUST BE AVOIDED [21]

1. Tax Returns/Payment Forms/Declaration Procedural Errors

a) No taxpayer's signature affixed.

b) No teller's initial on stamped "Received."

c) No date on stamped "Received."

d) No machine validation.

e) No TIN indicated.

f) No stamp "Received."

g) No prescribed deposit slip attached.

h) No return period/transaction period indicated.

i) Return period on return does not tally with return period uploaded.

j) Payment on Tax Return differs with payment on screen/deposit slip.

k) Actual collection date does not tally with uploaded collection date.

l) Taxpayer's name does not tally with the TIN per BCS-A/ITS.

m) TIN indicated does not tally with the TIN per BCS-A/ITS.

n) Uploaded Payment Form 0605 per ITS does not tally with the tax type indicated (RF/IT/VT/PM/MC).

o) Duplicate copy of tax return not filled-out.

p) Incomplete pages of the income tax returns (ITRs).

q) Several tax returns were totaled and included in one deposit slip.

Illustration No. 12: Images of Tax Returns with procedural errors. ICHDca

2. BCS-A Procedural Errors

a) Incorrect numbering of BCS-A reports. cDHAES

b) TIN per tax return differs from that indicated in the BCS-A.

c) Taxpayer's name per tax return/form/declaration does not tally with the name in the BCS-A.

d) Tax Return not attached to the BCS-A.

e) Amount indicated in the BCS-A does not tally with the tax return/payment form/declaration.

f) Tax Return submitted without corresponding BCS-A.

g) Wrong BCS-A Form submitted by some AAB's (Proof List Only).

h) Form Code per BCS-A differs from tax return.

i) Incorrect numbering of BCS-A Reports.

j) Tax return differs from the uploaded BCS-A.

F. A GLIMPSE OF THE MEMORANDUM OF AGREEMENT AMONG THE AUTHORIZED AGENT BANKS, THE BUREAU OF INTERNAL REVENUE AND THE BUREAU OF TREASURY

1. The AAB shall comply with and submit all requirements prescribed in the applicable issuances and other issuances that may be subsequently issued by the BIR, and assume all expenses concerning the accomplishment and submission thereof.

2. Abide by the rules and regulations promulgated by the BIR in connection with the MOA such as, but not limited to:

I. Provide satisfactory taxpayers services such as: [22] TCAScE

a) To accept ALL tax returns and the corresponding tax payments thereon during regular banking hours and to extend banking hours during tax deadlines.

b) To open bank operations two (2) Saturdays immediately prior to April 15 of every year and extend banking hours from 3:00 PM to 5:00 PM from April 1 to income tax payment deadline.

c) To accept check payments after check clearing time especially during tax deadlines.

d) To accept tax payments even after the prescribed due date.

e) To accept other banks' checks.

f) To accept downloaded and photocopied tax returns but originally filled out and signed by the taxpayer.

g) Not to impose any other additional fees on top of the tax payments from the taxpayers.

h) Not to set up limits as to the number of forms and taxpayers to be serviced.

i) Not to designate any particular hour/day for acceptance of tax payments during banking hours.

j) Not to require opening of deposit/accounts as a pre-requisite in accepting tax payments.

II. Have adequate infrastructure (manpower, branch offices, computer and communication technology) to remit accurate daily tax collections and transmit all documents and information on time.

III. Assign bank branch personnel who have satisfactorily undertaken the required trainings on the system of collection of internal revenue taxes through banks and technical systems (e.g., BIR-CBRS, EDTS and LBDES).

IV. Maintain at least eighty percent (80%) of AAB branches accredited, as applicable. ASEcHI

V. Comply with BIR reporting requirements as to timeliness and accuracy, i.e., error-free collection of information within 48 hours from the time of collection for banks under the EDTS, except during transition period, upon approval of the BIR, and during deadlines where a 72 hours transmission is authorized.

VI. Comply with regulations/orders that may be prescribed in the future relative to the collection system.

VII. Accept and process all tax returns with payments.

VIII. Inform the BIR of any corporate structural changes including, but not limited to, merger, buy-out, consolidation and similar changes.

IX. Protect all information received from the BIR and taxpayers pursuant to this agreement and treat them with strictest confidentiality. [23]

3. Pay the penalties in accordance with existing issuances and abide by the sanctions, if any, in accordance with the schedule of penalties and sanctions. [24]

4. Hold tax payments in a fiduciary capacity for the account of the national government (Bureau of Treasury). Such funds held in trust must then be considered as separate from other funds in its custody.

5. Allow authorized field auditors of the COA and the BIR to verify any document or record of the AAB pertaining to collection and remittance of internal revenue taxes, provided the law on secrecy of bank deposits is strictly observed; and provided, further, that such verification shall be made only during banking days, subject to prior written notice to the AAB issued by the Commissioner of the BIR.

6. Consistent with the MOA and policy to compensate for banking services [25] rendered by BIR/BOC-Authorized Agent Banks by shifting from collection float to transaction fee-based scheme, the BANK shall be compensated for facilitating BIR/BOC collections as follows: [26]

a) Ten Pesos (PhP10.00) for each electronic transaction; and

b) Forty Pesos (PhP40.00) for each over-the-counter transaction.

The Bank shall submit to BTr a certified correct report of the number of transactions which shall serve as basis for payment of the transaction fee. The BTr shall make payment to the BANK through fund transfer to the regular demand depository account of the BANK with BSP within five (5) banking days from end of each month.

The BTr shall transmit to BIR/BOC the number of transactions reported by the Bank, for validation within 15 banking days from receipt of BTr's endorsement of the BANK's report. cTDaEH

Any adjustments on the actual number of validated BIR/BOC transactions shall be effected against future payments to be made by BTr to the BANK.

The compensation scheme shall be based on the successfully uploaded BCS-A and shall likewise be the basis for any adjustment/s on future payments to be made by BTr to the AABs. [27]

APPENDIX B

Schedules of Penalties

NATURE OF VIOLATIONS

PENALTIES

A. PROCEDURAL ERRORS/VIOLATIONS

1.   Failure to Submit Consolidated Report of Daily Collection (CRDC) within the prescribed period.

P200.00 per day but not to exceed 25% of tax collected

2.   Failure to Transmit Collection Data processed under LBDES and eFPS within the prescribed period.

P200.00 per day but not to exceed 25% of tax collected

3.   Submission of Incomplete/Inaccurate Reports, such as but not limited to the following:

3.1.   No Bank Code in BCS/Incorrect numbering.

3.2.   No tax type indicated.

3.3.   No date of collection.

3.4.   Unmatched BCS information with actual returns, different TIN/s, no TIN of TP.

3.5.   BCS total amount that do not tally with total amount from documents.

3.6.   No signature of authorized bank official.

P200.00 per BCS but not to exceed 25% of the tax collected

4.   Acceptance/Submission of Tax Returns with incomplete data:

4.1.   No Signature of Taxpayer/Authorized Representative.

4.2.   No Name of Taxpayer.

4.3.   No TIN.

4.4.   No Machine Validation/Transaction Receipt for Efficient Service Machine (ESM).

4.5.   Payment on return differs from payment on Collection and Bank Reconciliation (CBR).

4.6.   Returns submitted without corresponding BCS.

Equal to or less than 10 errors per BCS — No Penalty, But in excess of 10 errors — P200.00 per erroneous return received

5.   Acceptance of Checks

5.1.   Not in accordance with RR No. 16-2002.

5.2.   Invalid or Dishonored checks due to error of the bank.

P1,000 per check

B. REMITTANCE VIOLATIONS

1.   Late Remittance (shall mean full remittance after due date provided the delay shall not exceed 15 days from due date).

Prevailing interbank borrowing rate + 5% until the total amount and increments are fully paid

2.   Under remittance (shall mean any of the following but not limited to:

2.1.   remittance beyond 15 days from due date whatever the circumstance.

2.2.   remittance based on BIR notice of discrepancy (e.g., BSP list of remittance vs. CRDC, BCS vs. CRDC, taxpayer's complaint of non-remittance of payment).

3.   Non-Remittance (shall mean no remittance is made)

Double the amount of under-remittance + 25% surcharge + 1/4 of 1% interest per day but shall not be less than prevailing interbank rate + 5% until the total amount and increments are fully paid; plus disaccreditation of bank branch and criminal liability in accordance with _____

C.   NON-COMPLIANCE WITH AABS OBLIGATION STATED IN 2.1 OF THE MOA

1.   1st Offense supported by written complaint of Taxpayer, RDO and other concerned party.

Reminder Letter to AAB-Branch copy furnished AAB Head Office

2.   2nd Offense.

P1,000 per verified violation per branch

3.   3rd Offense.

P3,000 per verified violation per branch

4.   4th Offense.

P5,000 per verified violation per branch.

5.   5th Offense.

Warning and suspension for thirty (30) days per branch

6.   More than five (5) offenses.

Referred to Bank Accreditation Committee (BAC) for disaccreditation of the branch

D.   NON-PAYMENT OF PENALTIES WITHIN THE PRESCRIBED PERIOD AS STATED IN THE NOTICE

Referred to Bank Accreditation Committee (BAC) for disaccreditation of the branch

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns/Payment Forms Generated from the Electronic One Time Transaction (eONETT) System

Details.Details:
In reference with Revenue Memorandum Circular (RMC) No.083-2024, taxpayers who have filed One-Time Transaction (ONETT) application via electronic One-Time Transaction (eONETT) System are no longer required to present the Tax Return Receipt Confirmation to Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) for the payment of ONETT-related taxes and certification fees. TIADCc

In connection thereto, all AABs are hereby advised to accept Tax Returns/Payment Forms generated from the eONETT System which bears the following notation, please see Annex "A" for sample ONETT tax return:

'This document is generated from the eONETT System. "TIN Verified" stamp and signature from RDO representative is NOT required. This also serves as proof that this tax return/payment form is electronically filed, in lieu of the Tax Return Receipt Confirmation.'

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns and Payments from Taxpayers under the Areas Affected by Southwest Monsoon and Typhoon "Carina"

Details.Details:

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Submission of AABs' Official E-Mail Address for the Service of the Warrant of Garnishment

Details.Details:
This is in connection with Bank Bulletin No. 2023-13 pertaining to the submission of the official electronic mail (e-mail) addresses of Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) in accordance with Revenue Regulations No. 11-2023, providing for the use of e-mail and electronic signature in relation to Section 208 of the National Internal Revenue Code (NIRC) of 1997, as amended, for the service of warrant of garnishment.

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns/Payment Forms by Authorized Agent Banks without Signature of Concerned Revenue Officer/Official in Compliance with Republic Act No. 11976 or the Ease of Paying Taxes Act

Details.Details:
With the implementation of the Republic Act No. 11976, otherwise known as the "Ease of Paying Taxes Act," and in relation with Bank Bulletin (BB) No. 2024-02, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are advised to accept the following: aScITE

1. The electronically filed tax returns/payment forms with printed copy of any of the following, as proof of filing:

a. Tax Return Receipt Confirmation received through email

b. Filing Reference Number (FRN) for returns filed thru Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS)

2. The printed copies of electronically filed BIR Payment Form 0605, even without the approval or signature by the authorized concerned revenue officers/officials of the Revenue District Office (RDO)/Large Taxpayers District Office (LTDO)/LT Division having jurisdiction over the concerned taxpayer.

3. The late filed tax returns even without the approval or signature by the authorized concerned revenue officers/officials of the RDO/LTDO/LT Division having jurisdiction over the concerned taxpayer.

For your guidance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Income Tax Returns/Payment of Internal Revenue Taxes by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) for Two (2) Consecutive Saturdays and Extension of Banking Hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the Period April 1-15, 2024

Details.Details:
In accordance with the provision of the Memorandum of Agreement executed by the AABs, Bureau of Internal Revenue and the Bureau of the Treasury, more particularly item 2.1.2 of the bank obligations which states that: CAIHTE

"The AAB shall:

1. x x x

2. x x x

2.1.1 x x x

2.1.2 To open bank operations two (2) Saturdays immediately prior to April 15 of every year and extend banking hours from 3:00 P.M. to 5:00 P.M. from April 1 to income tax payment deadline;"

In connection thereto, all AABs are hereby reminded to open two (2) Saturdays prior to April 15 Annual Income Tax deadline, as stated on the above provision of the MOA. Thus, AABs shall open and accept the printed copy of electronically filed income tax returns thru eBIRForms with the corresponding payment of taxes due thereon for the period April 1 to April 15, 2024. Likewise, AABs are advised to open and accept tax payments on April 6, 2024 and April 13, 2024; and to extend banking hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the period April 1 to 15, 2024.

All income tax payments that will be accepted on April 6 and 13, 2024, shall be reported in the Batch Control Sheet (BCS) as collection for the following working day, April 8, 2024 and April 15, 2024, respectively. However, the machine validation of the Annual Income Tax Return (AITR) in the deposit slip for the tax payment received shall be on the date of the actual receipt of collection. The remittance of the tax collections and the submission of the BCS, together with the supporting income tax returns and attachments, shall be in accordance with the existing procedures.

Further, all AABs are reminded on the following:

1. Accept the payment of manually filed income tax returns including its attachments from taxpayers enrolled in the Bureau's Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS) only in case of unavailability of the eFPS and eBIRForms facilities as announced by the BIR or the unavailability of the eFPS-AAB where the taxpayers are enrolled. aScITE

2. Accept the payment of manually filed income tax returns including its attachments from taxpayers only in case of unavailability of the eBIRForms facility.

This supersedes the Bank Bulletin No. 2024-01 dated February 20, 2024.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Taxation.Title: Acceptance of Tax Returns/Payments of Internal Revenue Taxes by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) for Two Consecutive Saturdays and Extension of Banking Hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the Period April 1-15, 2024

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns/Payment Forms by Authorized Agent Banks in Compliance with Republic Act No. 11976 or the Ease of Paying Taxes Act

Details.Details:
In relation to Section 47 of Republic Act (RA) No. 11976 or the "Ease of Paying Taxes (EOPT) Act," all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised to accept all printed copies of electronically filed tax returns/payment forms thru eBIRForms and the corresponding payment of taxes due thereon from taxpayers, notwithstanding the Revenue District Office's (RDO's) jurisdiction. DETACa

Likewise, all AABs are advised on the following procedures in the processing of out-of-district returns and payment of taxes due thereon:

1. Receive from the taxpayers in triplicate copies the printed copies of electronically filed returns tax returns/payment forms thru eBIRForms, necessary attachments thereto, if any, and the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR)-Bureau of the Treasury (BTr) deposit/payment slip.

A BIR-BTr deposit/payment slip shall have transaction date, name and Tax Identification Number (TIN) of taxpayers, BTr-BIR account number, account name which is BTr-BIR, name of the drawee bank and check number (for check payment), bank debit advice number (for debit system payment), and the amount of tax to be paid. Said deposit/payment slip shall be accomplished and issued in triplicate copies, distributed as follows:

a. Original (taxpayer's copy)

b. Duplicate (AAB's copy)

c. Triplicate (to be attached to the tax return/payment form)

2. Check the completeness of presented tax return/payment form, as well as the attached accomplished deposit/payment slip.

3. Stamp "RECEIVED" and "Out-of-District" on the three (3) copies of tax return/payment form.

Notes:

a. The attachments to the Annual Income Tax Return (AITR) shall be stamped only on the page of the Audit Certificate, the Balance Sheet and the Income Statement. The other pages of the financial statements and its attachments need not be stamped "RECEIVED." In case of corporations and other juridical persons, a maximum of two (2) extra copies of the audited financial statements for filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission should be stamped "RECEIVED." HEITAD

b. For acceptance of late payments, AABs shall accept the late filing tax returns stamped with the qualifier "LATE FILING" and supported by computation of the corresponding penalties by the concerned RDO/LTDO/LT Division. AABs shall stamp "FILED LATE" on the tax return/payment form and "INCREMENTS NOT PAID" if the additional penalties/fees are not paid by the taxpayers.

4. Accept tax payment and machine validate the BIR-prescribed deposit/payment slip accomplished by the taxpayer as evidence that the BIR tax payment was deposited to the account of the BTr. The machine validation must reflect on the BIR deposit/payment slip the date of payment, amount paid, transaction number, the name of the bank, branch code, teller's code and teller's initials.

5. Release to the taxpayer the duly stamped "RECEIVED" triplicate copy of tax return/payment form and the original copy of the machine validated deposit/payment slip.

6. Post the tax payment collected, using the online tellering system, by crediting the BTr demand deposit account in the AAB head office.

7. Batch separately the out-of-district returns from the tax returns received under the jurisdiction of the Host RDO.

In cases where the AABs are using their own BIR-approved tellering system in the encoding of payment details and generation of BCS, which cannot provide a separate BCS for out-of-district tax return/payment form, AABs shall manually indicate "Out-of-District" beside the item number of the corresponding tax payment information listed in the BCS prior to submission to the concerned Host RDO.

8. Encode the tax payment information into the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) or Bank System indicating the RDO Number of the accepting AAB branches in the required field of the LBDES or Bank System, instead of the RDO Number where the taxpayer is registered.

Note: Information details for cash payments shall consist of the date of transaction, name of taxpayer, TIN-Branch Code of taxpayer, form type, tax type, return period, amount of tax paid. For check payments, name of the drawee bank, check number and issue date shall be included.

9. Report all daily collections to respective Head Offices, for subsequent remittance to the BTr following the existing policies and procedures.

10. Accept out-of-district tax return/payment form with payments from taxpayers paying thru checks with different collecting AAB branch name indicated on the face of the check, provided that the payment is made through other branches of the same AAB. However, taxpayers shall indicate at the back of the check the name of the receiving AAB branch. aDSIHc

Moreover, accept check payment even without the name of receiving AAB branch, TIN and name of taxpayer indicated in the face of the check, provided that all check payments shall be made payable to the "Bureau of Internal Revenue" and the AAB shall require the taxpayers to write legibly the name of the receiving branch, TIN and name of taxpayer at the back of the check.

Further, all AABs are reminded on the following:

1. Accept the tax payments from taxpayers who are already within the bank's premises by the close of the AAB banking hours.

2. Accept check payments even after the bank clearing cut-off time and stamp the tax return/payment form "Received after cut-off/clearing time" or with similar stamp.

3. Accept the payment of manually filed tax return/payment form including its attachments from taxpayers enrolled in the Bureau's Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS) only in case of unavailability of the eFPS and eBIRForms facilities as announced by the BIR or the unavailability of the eFPS-AAB where the taxpayers are enrolled.

4. Accept the payment of manually filed tax return/payment form including its attachments from taxpayers only in case of unavailability of the eBIRForms facility.

For your guidance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns/Payments of Internal Revenue Taxes by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) for Two Consecutive Saturdays and Extension of Banking Hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the Period April 1-15, 2024

Details.Details:
In accordance with the provision of the Memorandum of Agreement executed by the AABs, Bureau of Internal Revenue and the Bureau of the Treasury, more particularly item 2.1.2 of the bank obligations which states that: HTcADC

"The AAB shall:

1. x x x

2. x x x

2.1.1 x x x

2.2.2 To open bank operations two (2) Saturdays immediately prior to April 15 of every year and extend banking hours from 3:00 P.M. to 5:00 P.M from April 1 to income tax payment deadline;"

In connection thereto, all AABs are hereby reminded to open two (2) Saturdays prior to April 15 Annual Income Tax deadline, as stated on the above provision of the MOA. Thus, AABs shall open and accept the tax returns/payments for the period April 1 to April 15, 2024 and also advised to open and accept tax payments on April 6, 2024 and April 13, 2024, and to extend banking hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the period April 1 to 15, 2024.

All income tax payments that will be accepted on April 6 and 13, 2024, shall be reported in the Batch Control Sheet (BCS) as collection for the following working day, April 8, 2024 and April 15, 2024, respectively. However, the machine validation of the Annual Income Tax Return (AITR) in the deposit slip for the tax collections and the submission of the BCS, together with the supporting income tax returns and attachments, shall be in accordance with the existing procedures.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Retrieval of BCS-A and the Corresponding Tax Returns

Details.Details:
It has come to the attention of this Office that there are still Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) which fail to submit the Batch Control Sheet (BCS-A) reports and its attachments upon the scheduled retrieval of the concerned Revenue District Offices (RDOs). DETACa

Please be informed that the retrieval shall be made on or before Tuesday, following the collection week, pursuant to the provision of Revenue Memorandum Order (RMO) No. 11-2008, taking into consideration the time prescribed for the AAB branch to transmit electronically the BCS-A to the Revenue Data Center (RDC), as provided for under Revenue Regulations (RR) No. 2-2008 which is forty-eight (48) hours for regular days and seventy-two (72) hours during tax deadlines.

To provide time for the preparation of the BCS-A and its accompanying tax returns, especially when the deadline for transmission falls on a Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday, following the collection week, all AABs are hereby reminded that the schedule of retrieval shall be on or before Tuesday, following the deadline for transmission, as illustrated below:

on or before October 10, 2023 (Tuesday)

Likewise, all AABs must ensure that the BCS-A and its accompanying tax returns are ready for pick up on the scheduled date of retrieval by the RDOs.

Furthermore, for data security purposes, all AABs are hereby ordered to refrain from sending the BCS-A reports, tax returns and corresponding attachments to the RDOs via courier; and consistently deliver the same directly to the concerned RDO, following strictly the prescribed frequency of retrieval under RMO No. 11-2008, as presented above. HEITAD

Moreover, all AABs are hereby advised to cooperate with the RDOs on the submission of required Forms, Certifications and other pertinent documents necessary in the process of retrieval, relative to the implementation of the Expansion on ISO 9001:2015 QMS Certification of this Bureau; and are reminded on their obligation to abide by the rules and regulations promulgated by the BIR, in connection with their Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) with the BIR and the BTr, to wit:

xxx xxx xxx"

For your guidance and strict compliance.

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Reiteration of Acceptance of Annual Income Tax Returns (AITRs) and Its Attachments for Calendar Year 2022

Details.Details:
It has come to the attention of this office that some Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) refuse to accept the attachments to the Annual Income Tax Returns (AITRs). Additionally, some AABs are requiring the taxpayers to present their Tax Identification Number (TIN) card or any identification showing the TIN of the taxpayer before accepting the tax payment. CAIHTE

In this regard, all AABs are hereby instructed to accept the attachments to the filed AITRs and follow the existing procedures on the processing of tax payments and the returns received.

Likewise, AABs are reminded on the following:

1. To accept originally signed printed copies of electronically-filed AITRs or computer-generated/photocopies of BIR official AITR, originally filled out and signed by the taxpayer or his/her/its duly authorized representative;

2. To accept tax payments without the need to present the TIN card or any identification card showing the TIN; and

3. To accept first installment payments of taxpayers, other than corporations, who elected to pay the tax due in two (2) equal installments. Provided, however, that the tax due is in excess of Two Thousand Pesos (P2,000.00). The second installment shall be paid on or before October 15 following the close of the applicable year.

For your guidance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Accreditation of Additional Authorized Agent Bank (AAB) Branch, Update of Branch Location and/or Merger of AAB Branch with Other AAB Branch

Details.Details:
This is relative to the reports by some Revenue District Offices (RDO) that there are AAB branches that changed branch address/location and/or merged with other AAB branch but did not inform the concerned RDO who has jurisdiction with the said branch of such changes. Allegedly, there were also inactive branches (no internal revenue taxes collection for at least six [6] consecutive months) or disaccredited branches that resumed accepting tax payments without informing the concerned RDO or the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) National Office. TCAScE

In view of the above, all AABs are reminded to notify the BIR on any change of AAB branch name/address/location and/or the merger of AAB branch with other AAB branch in order to update the BIR record/system, as provided in Section III. C and D of Revenue Memorandum Order No. 30-2001, as amended. The letter shall be addressed to The Chief, Collection Programs Division at Room 810, 8th Floor, BIR National Office Building, Agham Road, Diliman, Quezon City.

Likewise, for request of accreditation of additional branch/es, hard copy of the letter request together with the requirements enumerated below shall be addressed to the Assistant Commissioner, Collection Service, Attention: The Chief, Collection Programs Division. For immediate processing of request, soft copy of the letter request and documents required shall be sent through email at cpd.repcom@bir.gov.ph copy furnished: nanette.nievera@bir.gov.ph, ma.linda.bautista@bir.gov.ph and teodorico.alejo@bir.gov.ph. Nonetheless, hard copies of the documents shall still be required for submission.

1. Tax Identification Number (TIN) — to be indicated on the letter request

2. Sample print of machine validation

3. Sample copy of rubber stamps:

a. RECEIVED (indicating the Name of Bank and Branch Name, Bank Code, RDO Code, Teller Code, Teller's Initial, Date)

b. FILED LATE

c. RECEIVED AFTER CLEARING/CUT OFF TIME

d. INCREMENTS NOT PAID

e. OUT-OF-DISTRICT

4. Technical Specification of Computer Hardware and software (model of PC that will be used in the encoding of tax payments, specifically the installation of the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) of the BIR) ASEcHI

5. Certification that the branch personnel attended the training on acceptance of tax payments

Further, all AABs are likewise requested to provide signage to the AAB branches informing the public that said branch is authorized by the BIR to received payment of internal revenue taxes. Attached is the sample signage format.

For your guidance.

ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

By:

(SGD.) MARISSA O. CABREROS
Deputy Commissioner
Legal Group
Officer-in-Charge

Taxation.Title: Revising the Policies, Guidelines and Procedures in the Processing of Application for Bank Accreditation; Renewal of Accreditation and Disaccreditation of Authorized Agent Banks (AABs); AABs Merger/Buy-Out; Change of Names and/or Addresses; Monitoring of Performance and Evaluation of AABs; and Imposition of Penalties on AABs' Violations and Settlement of Unremitted Collection

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Annual Income Tax Returns (AITRs) for Calendar Year 2022 until April 17, 2023

Details.Details:
In connection with the issuance of Revenue Memorandum Circular No. 32-2023, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised to accept Annual Income Tax Returns (AITRs) for the CY 2022 and the corresponding payment of the taxes due thereon from taxpayers, notwithstanding the Revenue District Office (RDO) jurisdiction, until April 17, 2023.

In this regard, all AABs are advised on the following procedures in processing out-of-district returns and payment of taxes due thereon:

1. Stamp "RECEIVED" and "Out-of-District" in the three (3) copies of AITR.

Note:

The attachments to the AITR shall be stamped only on the page of the Audit Certificate, the Balance Sheet and the Income Statement. The other pages of the financial statements and its attachments need not be stamped "Received," and in case of corporations and other juridical persons at least 2 extra copies of the audited financial statements for filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission should be stamped "Received."

2. Batch the out-of-district AITR separately.

3. Encode the tax payment data using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) or Bank System indicating the RDO Number of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES or Bank System and NOT the RDO Number of the taxpayer.

4. Accept out-of-district AITR with payments from taxpayers paying thru checks even if the said checks have different collecting AAB branch name, provided that the payment is made through the same AAB. Taxpayers shall indicate the name of the receiving AAB branch that actually received the payment at the back of the check.

AABs shall accept check payment even without the name of receiving AAB branch indicated in the check, provided that all check payments shall be made payable to the "Bureau of Internal Revenue" and the AAB shall require the taxpayer to write legibly the TIN and name of taxpayer at the back of the check.

AABs are likewise reminded on the following:

1. Accept the tax payments from taxpayers who are already within the bank's premises by the close of the AAB banking hours.

2. Accept check payments even after the bank clearing cut-off time and stamp the tax return "Received after cut-off/clearing time" or with similar stamp.

3. Accept the payment of manually filed AITR from taxpayers enrolled in the Bureau's Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS) in case of unavailability of the eFPS facility as announced by the BIR or the unavailability of the eFPS-AAB where the taxpayer is enrolled.

For your guidance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Taxation.Title: Filing of Annual Income Tax Returns for Calendar Year 2022 as Well as Payment of Taxes Due Thereon until April 17, 2023

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks

Details.Details:

This is in conformity with the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP) Monetary Board Resolution No. 170.A dated February 9, 2023 prohibiting the subject bank from doing business in the Philippines and placing it under receivership with the Philippine Deposit Insurance Corporation (PDIC) as the designated receiver, as stated in the letter dated February 10, 2023 of Mr. Angel B. (SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.

February 10, 2023

ATTY. ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner
Bureau of Internal Revenue
BIR National Office Building
Agham Road, Diliman, Quezon City

Dear Commissioner Lumagui:

Please be informed that, pursuant to Section 30 of R.A. No. 7653 (New Central Bank Act), the Monetary Board, in Resolution No. 170.A dated February 9, 2023, prohibited RURAL BANK OF SAN MARCELINO, INC. ("Bank") with office address at #21 Agpalo St., Central, San Marcelino, Zambales, from doing business in the Philippines and directed the PHILIPPINE DEPOSIT INSURANCE CORPORATION (PDIC) as Receiver to proceed with the takeover and liquidation of the Bank in accordance with Section 12 of R.A. 3591, as amended.

The PDIC took over the Bank and its assets, records and affairs on February 10, 2023.

Upon the placement of the Bank under liquidation, the powers, functions and duties, as well as the allowances, remunerations and perquisites of the directors, officers and stockholders of the Bank are terminated. Accordingly, the directors, officers and stockholders shall be barred from interfering in any way with the assets, records, and affairs of the Bank.

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns/Payments of Internal Revenue Taxes by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) on March 25, 2023 and April 1, 2023, Saturdays and Extension of Banking Hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the Period April 1-17, 2023

Details.Details:
In accordance with the provision of the Memorandum of Agreement executed by the AABs, Bureau of Internal Revenue and the Bureau of the Treasury, more particularly item 2.1.2 of the bank obligations which states that:

"The AAB shall:

1. x x x

2. x x x

2.1.1 x x x

2.1.2 To open bank operations two (2) Saturdays immediately prior to April 15 of every year and extend banking hours from 3:00 P.M. to 5:00 P.M. from April 1 to income tax payment deadline";

All AABs are hereby reminded to open two (2) Saturdays prior to April 15 Annual Income Tax deadline, as stated on the above provision of the MOA. Thus, AABs are advised to open and accept tax payments on March 25, 2023 and April 1, 2023, considering that April 8, 2023 is declared as a regular holiday (Black Saturday); and to extend banking hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the period April 1 to April 17, 2023, since April 15, 2023 would fall on a Saturday.

In connection thereto, all income tax payments that will be accepted on March 25, 2023 and April 1, 2023, shall be reported in the Batch Control Sheet (BCS) as collection for the following working day, March 27, 2023 and April 3, 2023, respectively. However, the machine validation of the Annual Income Tax Return (AITR) in the deposit slip for the tax payment received shall be on the date of the actual receipt of collection. The remittance of the tax collections and the submission of the BCS, together with the supporting income tax returns and attachments, shall be in accordance with the existing procedures.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Transmission of CRDC — List of Adjustments by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs)

Details.Details:
In accordance with the Bureau's Internal Revenue Integrated System (IRIS) implementation, all AABs are hereby required to transmit the Consolidated Report of Daily Collection (CRDC) — List of Adjustment/s due to over-reporting/remittance of collections in Comma Separated Value (.CSV) file for accurate and timely capturing of details of adjustments in the collection reports. When transmitting the CRDC — List of Adjustment/s as prescribed in Bank Bulletin No. 2014-14, the AAB-Head Office shall use the following .csv filename format:

a. eCRDC with Supplemental and List of Adjustment/s

Original Report

:

xxxmmddyyCRDC01R.csv

Supplemental Report

:

xxxmmddyyCRDC51R.csv

List of Adjustment/s

:

xxxmmddyyCRDC52R.csv

b. eCRDC with Supplemental Report

Original Report

:

xxxmmddyyCRDC01R.csv

Supplemental Report

:

xxxmmddyyCRDC51R.csv

c. eCRDC with List of Adjustment/s

Original Report

:

xxxmmddyyCRDC01R.csv

List of Adjustment

:

xxxmmddyyCRDC51R.csv

Where:

xxx

-

Shall refer to the First three (3) digits of the AAB-Head Office's Bank Code

mmddyy

-

Shall refer to the Collection Date

CRDC

-

Constant

01

-

Shall refer to the Version

01   Original Version (01 to 50)

51   for Supplemental Report and/or List of Adjustment (51 to 99)

R or E

-

Shall refer to the Payment Channel

R    for Regular Payment Channel
e.g., LBDES

E    for Electronic Payment Channel
e.g., eFPS/EPS, GCash, PayMaya, PayTax, MYEG, ePAY, UPAY

The csv file of CRDC — List of Adjustment/s shall be e-mailed to ecrdc@bir.gov.ph, copy furnish rad_bnkrec@bir.gov.ph and the concerned Bank Analyst (attached as Annex "A") assigned at the Revenue Accounting Division.

This Bank Bulletin shall take effect for tax collections that will be made on December 1, 2022 and shall be in effect until revoked by another Bank Bulletin.

For your guidance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Electronic Submission of the Dishonored Check Details in Comma Separated Value Format

Details.Details:
In line with the implementation of the Bureau's Internal Revenue Integrated System-Collection, Remittance and Reconciliation (IRIS-CRR) which requires the auto-uploading of the details of Dishonored Check (DC) reported, the electronic submission of the Dishonored Check details in Comma Separated Value (.CSV) format by the Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) is hereby reiterated.

Relative thereto and in order to facilitate the capture and conversion of the Dishonored Check details needed in the IRIS-CRR, all AABs are hereby required that the DC details be electronically submitted in .CSV format in accordance with Annex "A" hereof. Likewise, to ensure the proper reporting of the DC details, the reasons for dishonored checks listed in Annex "B" shall be used in preparing the said required .CSV format.

While this will be an additional attachment in the Electronic Consolidated Report of Daily Collection (eCRDC), the same should be submitted with a different file name to distinguish the CRDC from the Dishonored Check details. The electronic submission of the DC details shall be made thru email to ecrdc@bir.gov.ph, copy furnish rad_bnkrec@bir.gov.ph.

For your guidance.

(SGD.) ROMEO D. LUMAGUI, JR.
Commissioner of Internal Revenue
