Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Processing of Tax Returns and the Procedures in the Sending of Batch Control Sheet (BCS)

Details.Details:
Based on reports from various district offices of this Bureau, some Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are continuously committing errors in encoding payment information in the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/AAB System.

In view of the above, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby ordered to cautiously encode payment-related information in the LBDES/AAB System to ensure that only the tax type code indicated by the taxpayer on the BIR Form No. 0605 shall be encoded or correctly selected on the applicable tax type field of the LBDES/AAB System.

All AAB branches are likewise reminded to observe the following:

a. Ensure that all payment-related information indicated by the taxpayer on the accomplished Deposit/Payment Slip matches with those indicated on the BIR payment form/tax return prior to acceptance of payment form/tax return and the encoding of the applicable information to prevent discrepancies from occurring.

b. Deposit/Payment Slips must be machine validated while all payment forms/tax returns and its attachments, as may be applicable, must be stamped with "RECEIVED."

Note: The attachments to the income tax return shall be stamped only on the page of the Audit Certificate, the Balance Sheet and the Income Statement. The other pages of the financial statements and its attachments need not be stamped "Received," and in case of corporations and other juridical persons at least two (2) extra copies of the audited financial statements for filing with the SEC should be stamped "Received" as provided in RMO Nos. 6-2010 and 13-2011.

c. Transmission of BCS to concerned Revenue Data Centers (RDCs)/National Office Data Center (NODC) is within forty-eight (48) hours on regular days and seventy-two (72) hours during deadlines except in transactions which the BIR specifically requires twenty-four (24)-hour transmission (e.g., payment of capital gains tax). Provided in Annex "A" of this bulletin are the procedures of sending BCS to concerned RDCs/NODC using their dedicated email accounts.

d. Coordinate with concerned Head Offices (HO) for the feedback of the daily status of transmission of BCS to BIR which are regularly sent by the latter to the dedicated email account of AAB HO. In cases of suspended or un-uploaded BCS due to errors, follow the procedures provided in Annex A of Bank Bulletin No. 2021-05.

e. Follow the procedures provided in Annex "B" in the updating of new BIR Forms to the LBDES.

For your guidance.

(SGD.) LILIA CATRIS GUILLERMO

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

ATTACHMENT

BIR Form No. 0605
Payment Form

ANNEX A.details:
Procedures on How to Attach and Send BCS File Using Email
for Over-the-Counter Transactions through LBDES

1) After encoding the daily collection transactions PRESS F5 to extract and print BCS.

2) Go to the local disk drive and look for C:/DE011 folder.

3) Double click DE011 folder to open and look for LBDESAVE folder.

4) Look for the compressed file to be sent to BIR having a file extension C

(note: the first 6 digits of the filename is the bank code followed by day of the month, then period then month with the letter c or C)

5) Attach file (bankcodedd.mmC) to your mail with Subject: BIR Collection or Collection File.

ANNEX B.details:
Updating of BIR Forms in the Forms Code Table under the Limited
Bank Data Entry System

1. From the main menu on screen, go to "Utilities" menu or press hotkey 'U' on the keyboard.

2. From the menu, select "Update codes table" submenu by using arrow keys to highlight the submenu then press enter or simply press hotkey 'U' on the keyboard.

3. Another submenu option will appear; this time you select "Form" by pressing enter key since the submenu is already highlighted or simply press hotkey 'F' on the keyboard.

4. Table will appear on screen with the key press command is on yellow color text below the screen indicate how to add/insert a new record on the list.

5. To add new record "(BIR Form Number to be added)," press 'Ctrl + N.'

6. Add the form code under Form Code column, description of the form on Description column, tax code under the Tax Type column, description of the tax code under the Tax Type Description column and frequency under the Frequency column.

7. Values to be added. (Frequency column is blank for all values):

Form Code

Form description

Tax Type

Tax Type Description

Frequency

8. Repeat procedures 5-7 if 2 or more records are to be added/inserted.

9. To save record, press 'Ctrl+W.' The system will automatically exit after pressing 'Ctrl+W.'

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Prescribed Batch Control Sheet (BCS) No. and the Use of Proper Revenue District Office (RDO) Codes in Reporting of BCS and Consolidated Report of Daily Collections (CRDC)

Details.Details:
This has reference to the significant number of transmitted BCS that were rejected by the BIR System due to incorrect assignment of BCS-A No. and to the sources of reconciling items in the reconciliation of collection per BCS and CRDC due to incorrect use of RDO Code particularly for split/merged RDOs in reporting BCS-A which result to non-uploading of the same.

Relative to the aforementioned, all AABs are hereby advised to strictly follow the use of the prescribed numeric formats in encoding BCS Number "BCS-A No. 00000." Likewise, AABs are reminded to initialized the assignment of BCS-A No., which will start from one (1), at the beginning of each year (e.g., BCS-A No. 00001).

Further, all AABs are also reminded to ensure that the RDO code assigned to the AAB branch is correctly indicated in the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/AAB System particularly the split/merged RDO Codes to avoid non-uploading of BCS-A. Details.Details:

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Clarifying the Deadline for the Filing of Annual Income Tax Returns (AITR) for Taxable Year Ending December 31, 2021

Details.Details:
All Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby informed that there is no extension on the filing of Annual Income Tax Returns (AITR) for taxable year 2021 and the payment of the corresponding taxes due thereon, the deadline remains to be on April 18, 2022.

However, taxpayers were advised that they can file an amended return and pay the corresponding tax due thereon until May 16, 2022, provided that their AITR to be amended are filed on or before April 18, 2022. Copy of the return filed on or before April 18, 2022 shall be attached to the amended return to be filed.

In this regard, all AABs are hereby advised to accept amended AITR and the taxes due thereon without the imposition of the corresponding increments, notwithstanding the Revenue District Office (RDO) jurisdiction. The existing procedures on the processing of out-of-district returns and payment of taxes shall be followed.

For your guidance.

CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

By:

(SGD.) MARISSA O. CABREROS
Deputy Commissioner
Legal Group
Officer-in-Charge

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns and Payment even Without the "TIN VERIFIED" Stamp and Signature of the Revenue District Officer (RDO)

Details.Details:
In line with the implementation of the Bureau's Electronic One-Time Transaction (eONETT) System, taxpayers can now generate and print the ONETT returns anytime and anywhere without the need for taxpayers to personally visit the district offices before paying the required ONETT-related tax. However, there are reports that some Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are still requiring that the returns should be stamped with "TIN VERIFIED" and be signed by the RDO.

In this regard, all AABs are hereby advised to accept payments pertaining to ONETT even without the "TIN VERIFIED" stamped in the return and without requiring the signature of the concerned RDO or any representative from the district. Furthermore, pursuant to Bank Bulletin 2021-18 in relation to the obligations of AABs, the non-requirement of "TIN VERIFIED" stamp shall also be applicable to all downloaded and photocopied tax returns, originally filled and signed, and thus, shall be accepted by the AABs.

This is in consonance with the provisions of Republic Act (R.A.) No. 11032, known as "Ease of Doing Business and Efficient Government Service Delivery Act of 2018" which encourages for a simpler process to facilitate the filing of returns and payment of taxes by taxpayers and will help reduce the number of times they will have to visit the district offices.

For your guidance and information.

CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

By:

(SGD.) MARISSA O. CABREROS
Deputy Commissioner
Legal Group
Officer-in-Charge

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Reiteration of Relevant Policies in the Acceptance of 2021 Annual Income Tax Return and Payment

Details.Details:
This bulletin is issued to reiterate the relevant responsibilities of the AABs pertaining to the acceptance of annual income tax returns and payments, as follows:

1. Accept all tax payments being made by the taxpayers using any of the following:

a. BIR official printed forms or copies of system-generated Filing Reference Numbers (FRNs);

b. Photocopies of returns/computer-generated or electronically-filed tax returns; and

c. Downloaded Annual Income Tax Returns (AITRs) originally filled out and signed by the taxpayer or his duly authorized representative as per Bank Bulletin No. 2018-05 dated April 5, 2018.

Accept the new versions of BIR Form Nos. 1700, 1701, 1701A, 1702-RT, 1702-EX and 1702-MX for the filing of Annual Income Tax Returns.

2. Receive the income tax returns by stamping the official receiving seal on the space provided for in the three (3) copies of the return, whether or not the taxpayer is under the jurisdiction of a regional office with Document Processing Division (DPD). Any copy of the return in excess of three (3) copies shall not be stamped "RECEIVED" by the AAB. Accordingly, in the case of corporations and other juridical persons covered by BIR Form No. 1702, stamping of "RECEIVED" shall be extended in at least two (2) additional copies of the audited financial statements, aside from those attached in the AITRs, to satisfy the requirements of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).

3. Stamp "RECEIVED" the attached financial statements to the income tax returns only on the page of the Audit Certificate, the Balance Sheet, and the Income Statement pursuant to RMO No. 13-2010 and the Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) executed between the SEC and the BIR. The other pages of the financial statements and its attachments need not anymore be stamped "RECEIVED."

4. Ensure that the pertinent portions of the income tax returns and/or deposit slips are machine-validated and the details of tax payments should be clearly imprinted in all copies thereof.

5. Accept payments made through checks (even without the receiving AAB Branch indicated in the check, provided that all check tax payments shall be made payable to the Bureau of Internal Revenue) and/or combination of cash and check/s in the payment for single tax liability, provided that the said checks are prepared in accordance with the requirements stated in Bank Bulletin No. 2020-19.

6. Report in the Batch Control Sheet (BCS) all income tax payments accepted on March 26, 2022 and April 02, 2022 as collection for the following working day, March 28, 2022 and April 04, 2022, respectively since. However, the machine validation of the AITR in the deposit slip for the tax payment received shall be on the date of actual receipt of collection. The remittance of the tax collections and the submission of BCS, together with the supporting income tax returns and attachments, shall be in accordance with the existing procedures.

7. Prepare the Batch Control Sheets (BCS) using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) for corporate income tax returns, only the form type code of 1702 should be reflected in the said report and the suffixes "RT," "EX" and "MX" must be disregarded pursuant to Bank Bulletin Nos. 2014-06 and 2016-28.

8. Comply with the obligations provided for in the MOA executed by the AABs, the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) and the Bureau of the Treasury (BTr) as provided in Bank Bulletin No. 2021-18.

9. Accept the tax payments from taxpayers who are already within the bank's premises by the close of the said extended banking hour.

10. Accept the manually filed and out-of-district returns, and corresponding payment of taxes from taxpayers enrolled in the eFPS in cases of unavailability of the eFPS facility, as announced by the BIR, through an advisory posted in the BIR website.

Encode the tax payment data using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/Bank system indicating the Revenue District Office (RDO) of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES/Bank system and NOT the RDO Number of the taxpayer.

11. Do not impose penalties for any violations committed by the taxpayers in the filing of their tax returns and payments of internal revenue taxes, since it is the Bureau which will be the one to impose whatever appropriate penalties incident to the said violations, in accordance with existing policies.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Taxation.Title: Acceptance of Tax Returns and Payments from Taxpayers under the Areas Classified as Alert Level 3 per Inter Agency Task Force (IATF) Resolution No. 155

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns and Payments from Taxpayers under the Areas Classified as Alert Level 3 per Inter Agency Task Force (IATF) Resolution No. 155

Details.Details:
Due to the declaration of Alert Level 3 classification as per IATF Resolution No. 155 in the National Capital Region (NCR), Cavite, Bulacan and Rizal for the period January 3 to 15, 2022, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) shall:

1. Accept all tax payments from taxpayers registered under the Revenue District Offices (RDOs) in the areas placed under Alert Level 3, including out-of-district returns and follow the following procedures:

a. Stamp the words "Out-of-District" on the face of the return;

b. Batch the out-of-district returns separately; and

c. Encode the tax payment data using the Limited Data Bank Entry System (LBDES)/Bank System indicating the Revenue District Office (RDO) of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES/Bank System and NOT the RDO number of the taxpayer.

2. Accept check payments from any taxpayer even without the name of receiving AAB Branch indicated in the check during the said period, provided that all check tax payments shall be made payable to the Bureau of Internal Revenue.

3. Accept all out-of-district returns with payments from taxpayers paying thru check even if the said checks have different collecting AAB branch name, provided that the payment is made through the same AAB. The taxpayer shall indicate the name of receiving AAB branch that actually received the payment at the back of the check.

This Bank Bulletin shall take effect immediately until the Alert Level 3 has been lifted.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns and Payments from Taxpayers under the Areas Affected by Typhoon Odette

Details.Details:

The tax deadlines falling for the period from December 20 to 31, 2021 may be accepted within thirty (30) days from the tax due date.

1. The following procedures shall be observed in the receipt of tax returns and tax payments from the above taxpayers:

a. Stamp the words "Out-of-District" on the face of the return;

b. Batch all out-of-district returns received in accordance with the existing revenue issuances, and prepare the corresponding Batch Control Sheet (BCS)-A for pick up by the representative of the Revenue District Office having jurisdiction over the collecting bank or by the representative of the Regional Data Processing Division (DPD).

c. Indicate the RDO Number of the accepting Bank Branch in the required field of the Limited Bank Data Entry System/Bank System and NOT the RDO Number of the taxpayers.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

No. 7653 (New Central Bank Act), the Monetary Board, in Resolution No. 1588.A November 25, 2021, prohibited RURAL BANK OF NABUNTURAN (COMPOSTELA VALLEY), INC. ("Bank"), with office address at Purok 10, Echavez St., Brgy. Poblacion, Nabunturan, Davao de Oro, from doing business in the Philippines and directed the PHILIPPINE DEPOSIT INSURANCE CORPORATION (PDIC) as Receiver to proceed with the takeover and liquidation of the Bank in accordance with Section 2 of R.A. 3591, as amended.

The PDIC took over the Bank and its assets, records and affairs on _________________________.

Upon the placement of the Bank under liquidation, the powers, functions and duties, as well as the allowances, remunerations and perquisites of the directors, officers and stockholders of the Bank are terminated. Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Combination of Cash and Check Payment for Single Tax Liability

Details.Details:
Pursuant to Revenue Regulations (RR) No. 16-2002, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby reminded that tax liabilities can be paid through cash, check or bank debit system. Relative thereto, all AABs are hereby advised to accept payments made through combination of cash and check/s in the payment for a single tax liability, provided that said checks are prepared in accordance with the provision of said RR.

Likewise, all AABs are mandated to accept tax payment partly made thru cash, checks or Tax Debit Memos (TDMs) duly and validly issued by the BIR.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Details.Details:

CAIHTE

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Payment for All Taxpayers under the Jurisdiction of National Capital Region (NCR), Iloilo City, Iloilo Province, Cagayan de Oro City, Gingoog City, Ilocos Norte, Bataan, Lapulapu City and Mandaue City

Details.Details:
Due to the declaration of Enhanced Community Quarantine (ECQ) in the NCR, Iloilo City, Iloilo Province, Cagayan de Oro City, Gingoog City, and Modified Enhanced Community Quarantine (MECQ) in Ilocos Norte, Bataan, Lapulapu City, Mandaue City, for the period August 6, 2021 to August 20, 2021, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) shall:

1. Accept all tax payments from taxpayers registered under the Revenue District Offices (RDOs) in the abovementioned areas placed under ECQ and MECQ, even out-of-district returns.

a. Batch the out-of-district returns separately; and

b. Encode the tax payment data using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/Bank System indicating the RDO of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES/Bank System and NOT the RDO Number of the taxpayer. CAIHTE

2. Accept check payments from any taxpayer even without the name of receiving AAB branch indicated in the check, provided that all check payment shall be made payable to the Bureau of Internal Revenue (with or without "IFO Name and TIN of the taxpayer" written on the check as previously required).

This bank bulletin shall take effect immediately until the ECQ and MECQ has been lifted.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Taxation.Title: Clarifying the Deadline for Filing of AITR for Taxable Year Ending December 31, 2020; Providing Guidelines in the Manner of Filing Thereof, etc.

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Supplemental Procedures for the Acceptance of Tax Returns as well as Payments Due Falling Within the Period March 22, 2021 to April 30, 2021

Details.Details:
In connection with Bank Bulletin 2021-06 relative to the acceptance of returns and tax payments for the period of March 22, 2021 to April 30, 2021, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised to:

1. Accept all payments from taxpayers for the abovementioned period even if they are outside the jurisdiction of the Revenue District Offices where they are registered and observe the following:

a. Batch the out-of-district returns separately; and

b. Encode the tax payment data using the Limited Data Bank Entry System (LBDES)/Bank System indicating the Revenue District Office (RDO) of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES/Bank System and NOT the RDO number of the taxpayer. HTcADC

2. Accept check payments from any taxpayer even without the name of receiving AAB Branch indicated in the check during said period. Provided, that all check tax payments shall be made payable to the Bureau of Internal Revenue.

3. Accept all out-of-district returns with payments from taxpayers paying thru check even if the said checks have different collecting AAB branch name, provided that the payment is made through the same AAB. The taxpayer shall indicate the name of receiving AAB branch that actually received the payment at the back of the check.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Payment for All Taxpayers Within the Area of Jurisdiction of Revenue Region (RR) No. 2-CAR

Details.Details:
This bank bulletin is issued to address the restrictions being encountered by taxpayers registered under RR No. 2, Cordillera Administrative Region particularly Revenue District Office (RDO) No. 7-Abra, RDO No. 8-Baguio City, RDO No. 9-Benguet, RDO No. 10-Mt. Province, RDO No. 11-Kalinga, Apayao and RDO No. 12-Ifugao in the filing of their returns and paying their taxes due to stricter quarantine protocols, limited capacity of mass transportation and restricted mobility of taxpayers.

In view of the above, all AABs within the jurisdiction of RR No. 2 are hereby advised to:

1. Accept all tax payments from taxpayers registered under the aforementioned revenue district offices, even out-of-district returns.

a. Batch the out-of-district returns separately; and

b. Encode the tax payment data using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/Bank System indicating the Revenue District Office (RDO) of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES/Bank system and NOT the RDO Number of the taxpayer. DETACa

2. Accept check payments from any taxpayer registered under RR No. 2 even without the name of the receiving AAB branch indicated in the check, provided that these check tax payments are payable to the Bureau of Internal Revenue.

This bank bulletin shall take effect immediately until the strict protocol in the area has been lifted.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Check as Payment of Internal Revenue Taxes

Details.Details:
In view of numerous queries received from Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) regarding the acceptance of checks in payment of internal revenue taxes, all AABs are hereby advised on the following:

I. Manager's and Cashier's Checks (MCs & CCs)

Manager's and Cashier's Checks (MCs & CCs) are acceptable modes of payment under RR No. 16-2002. The MC/CC issuing bank shall indicate on the space for *PAY TO THE ORDER OF* the following data: (1) presenting/collecting bank or the bank where the payment is to be coursed and; (2) FAO (For the account of) Bureau of Internal Revenue as payee; and under the *Account Name* the Taxpayer's Name and Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN). No MC and CC shall be accepted without the Taxpayer's name and TIN indicated therein.

II. Checks that are not in accordance with the requirements of the Check Image Clearing System (CICS) of the Philippine Clearing House Corporation (PCHC) are not acceptable for payment of internal revenue taxes.

III. Taxpayer's Account Name and Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN)

In cases where the Taxpayer's name and TIN are not pre-printed on the face of the check, the AAB shall require the Taxpayer to type or write them legibly on the face/back of the check.

IV. The following checks shall not be considered accommodation checks for the purpose of and should be accepted in payment for internal revenue taxes:

a) Checks drawn against a joint or multiple account for the purpose of tax payment of the personal tax liability of any of the members thereof provided that the name and TIN of the paying member/s shall be indicated on the back/face of the check;

b) Checks drawn against the personal account of the owner of a single proprietorship in payment of the tax liability of his/her business;

c) Check drawn against the account of a single proprietorship in payment of the tax liability of the owner provided that the name and TIN of the owner are indicated at the face/back of the check;

d) Check issued by either of the spouses to pay their income tax liabilities.

V. Personal/company/partnership checks issued by tax/business agents/practitioners in payment of their client/s tax liabilities are accommodation checks and are not acceptable.

VI. One check shall be drawn for the payment of a single internal revenue tax liability. This means that if a taxpayer has two or more tax liabilities, say one income and another for percentage tax, separate checks shall be drawn for each kind of tax. However, two or more checks and/or combination of cash and check/s may be accepted in payment of a single internal revenue tax liability.

For guidance and compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Payments for All Taxpayers under the Jurisdiction of National Capital Region, Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna and Rizal

Details.Details:
Due to the declaration of Modified Enhanced Community Quarantine in National Capital Region (NCR), Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna and Rizal for the period August 4, 2020 to August 18, 2020, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) shall:

1. Accept all tax payments from taxpayers registered under Revenue District Office Nos. 24 to 34, 38 to 54B, even out-of-district returns.

a. Batch the out-of-district returns separately; and

b. Encode the tax payment data using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/Bank System indicating the Revenue District Office (RDO) of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES/Bank system and NOT the RDO Number of the taxpayer.

2. Accept over-the-counter filing of returns and payment of taxes due thereon by eFPS filers who encountered problem in paying through eFPS, taxpayer may present printed copy of the pop-up message screenshot as proof of unsuccessful eFiling and/or copy of efiled returns.

3. Accept check payments from any taxpayer even without the name of receiving AAB branch indicated in the check during MECQ period. Provided that all check tax payment shall be made payable to Bureau of Internal Revenue.

This bank bulletin shall take effect immediately until MECQ has been lifted and placed National Capital Region (NCR), Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna and Rizal under General Community Quarantine (GCQ).

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Implementation of Certain Policies in the Acceptance of Annual Income Tax Returns (AITR) and Other Tax Returns Whose Due Dates Fall within the Community Quarantine Period

Details.Details:
In connection with the issuance of Revenue Regulations (RR) No. 11-2020, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) shall accept payments for tax returns mentioned under Section 2 of said RR (BIR Form Nos. 1700, 1701, 1701A, 1701Q, 1702RT, 1702EX, 1702MX, 1702Q, 2550M, 1600WP, 2550Q, 2551Q, 1702Q, 2000, 2000-OT, 1600, 1601C, 2200M, 1601EQ, 1601FQ, 1602Q, 1603Q, 0619E, 0619F, 0620, 1621, 1704, 1606, 1706, 1707, 1707A, 1800, 1801, 2552, 2553 and 0621DA) until the extended due dates/deadlines of filing/payment of said returns without imposition of corresponding penalties to taxpayers.

In view thereof, the BIR reiterates the relevant responsibilities of the AABs pertaining to the acceptance of AITR for CY 2019 and other tax returns referred herein and the corresponding payments of the taxes due thereon, as follows:

1. Accept all tax payments even out-of-district returns.

a. Batch the out-of-district returns separately; and

b. Encode the tax payment data using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/Bank System indicating the Revenue District Office (RDO) of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES/Bank system and NOT the RDO Number of the taxpayer.

2. Accept all tax payments being made by the taxpayers using any of the following:

a. BIR official printed forms and copies of system-generated Filing Reference Numbers (FRNs);

b. Photocopies of returns/computer-generated or electronically-filed tax returns; and

c. Downloaded BIR Forms/tax returns originally filled out and signed by the taxpayers or his duly authorized representative.

3. Receive the income tax returns and other tax returns by stamping the official receiving seal on the space provided for in the three (3) copies of the return, whether or not the taxpayer is under the jurisdiction of a regional office with Document Processing Division (DPD). Any copy of the return in excess of three (3) copies shall not be stamped "RECEIVED" by the AAB. Accordingly, in the case of corporations and other juridical persons covered by BIR Form No. 1702, stamping of "RECEIVED" shall be extended in at least two (2) additional copies of the audited financial statements, aside from those attached in the AITRs, to satisfy the requirements of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). CAIHTE

4. Stamp "RECEIVED" the attached financial statements to the income tax returns only on the page of the Audit Certificate, the Balance Sheet, and the Income Statement pursuant to RMO No. 13-2010 and the Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) executed between the SEC and the BIR.

5. Ensure that the pertinent portion of the income tax returns and other tax returns and/or deposit slips are machine-validated and the details of tax payments should be clearly imprinted in all copies thereof.

6. Accept payments made through checks or combination of cash and check/s or combination of two or more checks in the payment for single tax liability/return. Further, to accept checks which are prepared payable to the Bureau of Internal Revenue, (with or without "IFO Name and TIN of the taxpayer" written on the check payment as previously required).

7. Prepare the Batch Control Sheets (BCS) using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) for corporate income tax returns, only the form type code of 1702 should be reflected in the said report and the suffixes "RT", "EX" and "MX" must be disregarded pursuant to Bank Bulletin Nos. 2014-06 and 2016-28.

8. Comply with the obligations provided for in the MOA executed by the AABs, the BIR and the Bureau of Treasury (BTr).

9. Accept the tax payments from taxpayers who are already within the bank's premises by the close of the AAB banking hours.

10. Accept check payments even after the bank clearing/cut-off time and just stamp the tax return "Received after cut-off/clearing" or with similar stamp.

11. Accept the payment of manually filed and out-of-district returns from taxpayers enrolled in the Bureau's Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS) in case of unavailability of the eFPS facility as announced by the BIR, through an advisory posted in the BIR website.

12. Do not impose penalties for any violations committed by the taxpayers in the filing of their tax returns and payments of internal revenue taxes, since it is the Bureau which will be the one to impose whatever appropriate penalties incident to the said violation, in accordance with existing policy. DETACa

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Implementation of Certain Policies in the Acceptance of Annual Income Tax Returns (AITR) for Calendar Year 2019 and Other Tax Returns Whose Due Dates Fall within the Community Quarantine Period

Details.Details:
In connection with the issuance of Revenue Memorandum Circular (RMC) No. 28-2020, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) shall accept payment of AITR (BIR Form Nos. 1700, 1701, 1701A, 1701Q, 1702RT, 1702EX, 1702MX, 1702Q) for CY 2019 until May 15, 2020 without imposition of corresponding penalties to taxpayers.

Likewise, pursuant to RMC No. 30-2020, all AABs shall accept tax payments for tax returns (BIR Form Nos. 2550M, 1600WP, 2550Q, 1702Q, 2000, 2000-OT, 1600, 1601C, 2200M, 1606, 1706, 1707, 1800 and 1801) whose due dates/deadlines fall during the quarantine period within thirty (30) calendar days from the due dates/deadlines of filing/payment of said returns without imposition of corresponding penalties to taxpayers.

In view thereof, this Bulletin is issued to reiterate the relevant responsibilities of the AABs pertaining to the acceptance of AITR for Calendar Year 2019 and other tax returns whose due dates fall within the Enhanced Community Quarantine period and the corresponding payments of the taxes due thereon, as follows:

1. Accept all tax payments even out-of-district returns;

Encode the tax payment data using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/Bank System indicating the Revenue District Office (RDO) of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES/Bank system and NOT the RDO Number of the taxpayer.

2. Accept all tax payments being made by the taxpayers using any of the following:

a. BIR official printed forms and copies of system-generated Filing Reference Numbers (FRNs);

b. Photocopies of returns/computer-generated or electronically-filed tax returns; and CAIHTE

c. Downloaded BIR Forms/tax returns originally filled out and signed by the taxpayers or his duly authorized representative.

3. Receive the income tax returns and other tax returns by stamping the official receiving seal on the space provided for in the three (3) copies of the return, whether or not the taxpayer is under the jurisdiction of a regional office with Document Processing Division (DPD). Any copy of the return in excess of three (3) copies shall not be stamped "RECEIVED" by the AAB. Accordingly, in the case of corporations and other juridical persons covered by BIR Form No. 1702, stamping of "RECEIVED" shall be extended in at least two (2) additional copies of the audited financial statements, aside from those attached in the AITRs, to satisfy the requirements of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC);

4. Stamp "RECEIVED" the attached financial statements to the income tax returns only on the page of the Audit Certificate, the Balance Sheet, and the Income Statement pursuant to RMO No. 13-2010 and the Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) executed between the SEC and the BIR. The other pages of the financial statements and its attachments need not anymore be stamped "RECEIVED."

5. Ensure that the pertinent portion of the income tax returns and other tax returns and/or deposit slips are machine-validated and the details of tax payments should be clearly imprinted in all copies thereof.

6. Accept payments made through checks and/or combination of cash and check/s in the payment for single tax liability, provided that the said checks are prepared in accordance with the provisions of Revenue Regulations No. 16-2002.

7. Report in the Batch Control Sheet (BCS) all tax payments accepted on March 28, 2020 and April 4, 2020 as collection for the following working day March 30, 2020 and April 6, 2020, respectively. However, the machine validation of the income tax returns in the deposit slip for the tax payment received shall be on the date of actual receipt of collection. The remittance of the tax collections and the submission of BCS, together with the supporting income tax returns and other tax returns including its attachments shall be in accordance with the existing procedures.

8. Prepare the Batch Control Sheets (BCS) using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) for corporate income tax returns, only the form type code of 1702 should be reflected in the said report and the suffixes "RT," "EX" and "MX" must be disregarded pursuant to Bank Bulletin Nos. 2014-06 and 2016-28. DETACa

9. Comply with the obligations provided for in the MOA executed by the AABs, the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) and the Bureau of the Treasury (BTr).

10. Accept the tax payments from taxpayers who are already within the bank's premises by the close of the AAB banking hours.

11. Accept the payment of manually filed and out-of-district returns from taxpayers enrolled in the eFPS in cases of unavailability of the eFPS facility as announced by the BIR, through an advisory posted in the BIR website.

Encode the tax payment data using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/Bank System indicating the Revenue District Office (RDO) of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES/Bank system and NOT the RDO Number of the taxpayer.

12. Do not impose penalties for any violations committed by the taxpayers in the filing of their tax returns and payments of internal revenue taxes, since it is the Bureau which will be the one to impose whatever appropriate penalties incident to the said violation, in accordance with existing policy.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Suspension of Deadlines in the Acceptance of Tax Returns and Payment of Internal Revenue Taxes of Taxpayers in the Province of Batangas

Details.Details:
In view of the announcement of Batangas Governor Mark Leviste declaring the province of Batangas under the State of Calamity due to the recent volcanic eruption of the Taal Volcano affecting numerous cities, towns and municipalities in its vicinity, this Office found it proper to suspend the deadlines, for the month of January, on the filing and payment of tax returns in the area until such time that the situation returns to normal.

All Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised to accept tax payments from the taxpayers under the jurisdiction of Revenue District Offices (RDOs) No. 58 (Batangas City, West Batangas) and No. 59 (Lipa City, East Batangas) that are directly affected by the volcanic eruption without imposing penalties for their tax returns until an advisory from this Office is issued to resume regular operations.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Updating the Limited Bank Data Entry System and AAB Electronic/Online Payment Facilities to Reflect the Revenue District Office No. 21C-Clark Freeport Zone

Details.Details:
All Authorized Agent Banks are hereby advised on the creation of Revenue District Office (RDO) No. 21C-Clark Freeport Zone, as provided in Revenue Administrative Order (RAO) No. 6-2019 dated October 6, 2019.

In view thereof, all AABs are advised to update said new RDO in the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) following the procedures below:

1. Request a soft copy of RDO.DBF file from the Collection Programs Division (CPD) or Revenue Data Center Luzon 1 through email address either at cpd.repcom@bir.gov.ph or rdcluzon1.calasiao@bir.gov.ph.

2. Save the soft copy of RDO.DBF in the Desktop. The LBDES must be closed before saving the copy of the said file.

3. Copy the RDO.DBF file to C:\de011\DATA folder and click "YES" when asked to overwrite the file.

4. Open the Utilities -> Update Codes Table -> RDO code in LBDES to check the updated list of RDO that was loaded in the LBDES.

All received tax payments shall be batched together with the tax returns and supporting documents and shall be submitted to RDO No. 21C-Clark Freeport Zone located at 3rd Floor RDO21A North Pampanga BOR Complex, Mc Arthur Hi-way, Sindalan City of San Fernando.

Attached herewith and marked as Annex "A" of this Bulletin is the list of AABs who will now accept tax payments under the jurisdiction of RDO No. 21C-Clark Freeport Zone.

AABs accepting tax payments through electronic/online facilities shall likewise add RDO No. 21C-Clark Freeport Zone in the list of RDO selection.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Extension of Deadline in the Acceptance of Tax Returns and Payment of Internal Revenue Taxes of Taxpayers in the Province of Isabela

Details.Details:
In view of the issuance of Provincial Executive Order No. 56 by the Provincial Government of Isabela declaring November 15, 2019 as a Special Non-Working Holiday for the whole province of Isabela to ensure the safety of its people from the expected effects of tropical depression "Ramon," the deadline for the filing and payment of tax returns that are due on November 15, 2019 has been extended to November 18, 2019.

All Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised to accept tax payments from the taxpayers under the jurisdiction of Revenue District Office (RDO) No. 15-Naguilian, Isabela without imposing penalties for their tax returns that are due on November 15, 2019, provided that they file and pay the same on November 18, 2019.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.To: Encoding of the Buyer's Name and Taxpayer's Identification Number for Transfer Tax Payment of BIR Form 1606 (Withholding Tax Remittance Return for Onerous Transfer of Real Property Other Than Capital Asset, Including Taxable and Exempt)

Details.Details:
All AABs are advised that the proper encoding of BIR Form 1606 (Withholding Tax Remittance Return for Onerous Transfer of Real Property Other than Capital Asset, including taxable and exempt), Annex "A" hereof, as payment for transfer tax should be in the name and TIN of the buyer, instead of the name and TIN of the seller, even if it was the latter who paid the corresponding tax due. This return is filed by every Withholding Agent/Buyer on the sale, transfer or exchange of real property. cHDAIS

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Submission of Proof of Unsuccessful eFiling Attempt of eFPS Taxpayers

Details.Details:
In view of the intermittent connectivity of the Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS) which is experienced usually during tax deadlines due to voluminous transactions, a number of work-around procedures have been recommended to resolve the said matter. cTDaEH

All eFPS taxpayers are directed to file either through the eBIR Forms or manually file thru the over-the-counter facility of the AABs. Manual filing of returns of eFPS filers require an attached printed copy of the screenshot of the pop-up message as proof of unsuccessful eFiling attempt in the eFPS.

Accordingly, all AABs are hereby advised to accept over-the-counter filing of returns of eFPS filers provided that there is an attached printed copy of the screenshot of the pop-up message as proof of unsuccessful eFiling attempt in the eFPS. ITAaHc

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Taxation.Title: Over-the-Counter Acceptance of Certain Tax Returns/Payments of Internal Revenue Taxes due to the Unavailability of the eFPS

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Over-the-Counter Acceptance of Certain Tax Returns/Payments of Internal Revenue Taxes due to the Unavailability of the Bureau's Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS)

Details.Details:
In view of the continued intermittent/unavailability of the eFPS due to certain technical problems, taxpayers enrolled in eFPS are instructed to file the returns manually or use the eBIR Forms facility and pay the corresponding tax dues thru over-the-counter with their respective Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) located within their locality. caITAC

In this regard and to further clarify the previously issued Bank Bulletin No. 2019-04, all AABs are hereby advised to accept the manually filed and out-of-district returns, and the corresponding payment of taxes from taxpayers enrolled in eFPS without the penalties for manual and/or "out-of-district" filing and payment, provided that they file and pay on or before the prescribed deadlines, until such time that an advisory had been issued declaring the restoration of the eFPS.

Likewise, AABs are advised to encode the tax payment data using the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)/bank system indicating the Revenue District Office (RDO) of the accepting AAB branch in the required field of the LBDES/bank system and NOT the RDO Number of the taxpayer.

Please be advised that a separate advisory will be issued to inform the taxpayers under Revenue District Office Nos. 116, 121, 123, 124, 125, 126 and 127 on the place and manner of filing of their returns and the payment of the taxes due thereon. TAIaHE

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Details.Details:
The provisions of the Memorandum of Agreement executed by the Authorized Agent Banks (AABs), the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) and the Bureau of Treasury (BTr), more particularly Item 2.1.2 of the bank obligations, prescribe that: cDSAEI

"The AAB shall:

1. x x x

2. x x x

2.1.1 x x x

Accordingly, all AABs are hereby reminded to accept tax payments on April 06, 2019, and April 13, 2019, and to extend banking hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the period April 1 to April 15, 2019.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

Original Law.Subject: Intermittent Connectivity of the Electronic Filing and Payment System
Original Law.To: All Authorized Agent Banks

Details.Details:
In view of the intermittent/erratic connectivity while using Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS), the taxpayers were advised by this Bureau, through an unnumbered Memorandum dated October 24, 2018, to use the Electronic Bureau of Internal Revenue Forms (eBIR Forms) facility for the filing of their tax returns and to pay their corresponding taxes through the over-the-counter (thru cash, checks or debit), mobile (GCash) or the Debit/Credit Card payment, until another advisory has been issued for the availability/accessibility of the said eFPS System. HTcADC

Accordingly, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised to accept the generated tax returns filed by the taxpayers through the eBIR Forms System or the print-out of the e-mail notification confirming the receipt of the tax return filed.

All AABs are further advised not to require concerned taxpayers to proceed first to their respective RDOs for manual payment approval, especially those coming from the Large Taxpayers group, prior to the acceptance of the above said tax payments. CAIHTE

Consequently, all tax payments where the deadline falls from October 24, 2018 onwards shall be allowed to file and pay without corresponding penalties until such time that an advisory shall have been issued declaring the restoration of the eFPS.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) ARNEL SD. GUBALLA

Deputy Commissioner

Operations Group

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Intermittent Accessibility/Availability of the Bureau's Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS)

Details.Details:
In view of the intermittent accessibility/availability of the Bureau's Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS) encountered by the taxpayers mandated to use the same since September 10, 2018, they were advised to use the eBIRForms facilities of the Bureau in the filing of the requisite tax return, particularly BIR Form Nos. 1600, 1601-C, 0619-E and 0619-F, and pay the tax due thereon either electronically or manually through Authorized Agent Banks (AABs)' Over-the-Counter facilities under the jurisdiction of the Revenue District Office (RDO) where they are registered. acEHCD

Hence, all AABs are advised not to refuse payments of the aforesaid taxpayers. These taxpayers shall present the generated tax return filed through eBIRForms or the print-out of the Email notification confirming the receipt of the tax return filed. AABs shall not require these taxpayers to proceed first to the RDO for manual payment approval prior to acceptance of the payment.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CELIA C. KING

Deputy Commissioner

Details.Details:
In view of the revision of some of the procedures in the processing of tax returns, certain policies prescribed under Bank Bulletin No. 2014-08, particularly on the receipt and stamping of only two (2) copies of tax returns by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) under the physical jurisdiction of Revenue Region (RR) No. 2-Cordillera Administrative Region, RR No. 5-Caloocan City, RR No. 7-Quezon City and RR No. 9A-CABAMIRO and 9B-LAQUEMAR, have to be revised. aDSIHc

In this regard, all AABs under the aforesaid revenue regions are hereby advised to receive and stamp three (3) copies of any kind of tax return, where the original and duplicate copies shall be retrieved by the concerned BIR Office from the AAB, and the triplicate copy shall be for the taxpayer's copy.

Other AABs not earlier affected by Bank Bulletin No. 2014-08 which inadvertently accepted only two (2) copies of tax returns are hereby directed to stop the said practice, and follow the existing prescribed policy of accepting three (3) copies of tax returns.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Manually Filed Quarterly Remittance Return of Final Income Taxes Withheld on Fringe Benefits Paid to Employees Other Than Rank and File (BIR Form No. 1603Q)

Details.Details:
It has come to the attention of this Office that there are certain branches of Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) which refuse to accept the Quarterly Remittance Return of Final Income Taxes Withheld on Fringe Benefits Paid to Employees Other Than Rank and File (BIR Form No. 1603Q) and payment of the corresponding tax on the ground of late filing and payment of the said tax, the penalties of which should first be computed by the concerned Revenue District Office.

Please be informed that pursuant to the Tax Reform Acceleration and Inclusion (TRAIN) Law, the deadline for the filing of Quarterly Remittance Return of Final Income Taxes Withheld on Fringe Benefits Paid to Employees Other Than Rank and File (BIR Form No. 1603Q) for non-eFPS filers and eFPS filers has been changed from "on or before the 10th day of the month" and "on or before the 15th day of the month" respectively, to "last day of the month following the close of the quarter during which the withholding was made."

In this connection, all AABs are hereby advised to accept the said tax return and the corresponding payment of the tax, without penalties, considering that the deadline will fall on April 30, 2018, Monday.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Over-the-Counter Acceptance of Certain Tax Returns/Payments of Internal Revenue Taxes Due to the Unavailability of the eFPS

Details.Details:
With regards to the unavailability of the Bureau's electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS) due to certain technical problems, all eFPS taxpayers have been instructed to file their tax returns using the eBIRForms facility and to pay the corresponding taxes "over-the-counter" with their respective Authorized Agent Banks (AABs).

Accordingly, all AABs are hereby advised to accept "over-the-counter" payments for all taxes being paid through the eFPS which deadlines fall on April 25, 2018 without corresponding penalties for late filing until such time that an advisory shall have been issued declaring the restoration of the eFPS.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY

Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Reiteration of the Bank Bulletins Applicable to the Filing of the 2017 Income Tax Return and Payment of the Corresponding Income Tax Due

Details.Details:
This is to reiterate the provisions of Bank Bulletin No. 2015-06 and Bank Bulletin No. 2016-09 for purposes of filing of the 2017 income tax return and payment of the corresponding income tax due.

In this connection, all AABs are hereby reminded to accept all tax payments being made by the taxpayers using either BIR official printed forms, copies of system-generated Filing Reference Numbers (FRNs), photocopied returns/computer-generated or electronically filed tax returns, provided that the said forms are originally filled-out and signed by the taxpayer or his/her/its duly authorized representatives and that the said computer-generated income tax forms are printed in the format provided in Revenue Memorandum Order No. 24-2013 dated September 11, 2013, whether or not these are accompanied with complete attachments.

Likewise, this Bureau will be the one to impose whatever appropriate penalties incident to the violations that may be committed by the taxpayers in their tax transactions.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns/Payments of Internal Revenue Taxes by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) on April 7, 2018 and April 14, 2018, Saturdays, and Extension of Banking Hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the period April 1 to April 16, 2018

Details.Details:
The provisions of the Memorandum of Agreement executed by the Authorized Agent Banks (AABs), the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) and the Bureau of Treasury (BTr), more particularly Item 2.1.2 of the bank obligations, prescribe that:

"The AAB shall:

1.      x x x

2.      x x x

2.1.1      x x x

2.1.2      To open bank operations two (2) Saturdays immediately prior to April 15 of every year and extend the banking hours from 3:00 P.M. to 5:00 P.M. from April 1 to income tax deadline;"

Accordingly, all AABs are hereby reminded to accept tax payments on April 07, 2018, and April 14, 2018, and to extend banking hours up to 5:00 P.M. for the period April 1 to April 16, 2018.

Moreover, considering that April 15, 2018 shall fall on a Sunday, the income tax payment deadline shall be extended to April 16, 2018, Monday.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: Acceptance of BIR Form No. 0605 without the Required Approval or Signature of Authorized BIR Personnel in Relation with the Implementation of Republic Act No. 10963 (TRAIN Law)
Original Law.To: All Authorized Agent Banks

Details.Details:
Pursuant to Republic Act No. 10963, Tax Reform for Acceleration and Inclusion (TRAIN) Law, particularly on the remittance of creditable and final withholding taxes, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised to observe the following:

1.       The taxes withheld within the first two (2) months of every taxable quarter shall be remitted through BIR Form No. 0605 on or before the 10th day (for over-the-counter filers) or 15th day (for eFPS filers) of the following month of withholding until an enhanced monthly withholding remittance form is available; and

2.       The Alphanumeric Tax Code to be used in the filing and remittance of withholding taxes paid through BIR Form 0605 shall be "MC 200" and the Tax Type shall be "WE" for Expanded Withholding Tax or "WF" for Final Withholding Tax, whichever is applicable.

Further, in connection with the above and in consonance with Bank Bulletin No. 2015-18, all AABs are likewise advised to accept all payments for whatever purpose, using the BIR Payment Form 0605, even without prior signature of or approval by the authorized concerned revenue officers/officials of the Revenue District Office (RDO) having jurisdiction over the concerned taxpayer.

Please be guided accordingly.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Details.Details:
In accordance with the implementation of Republic Act (RA) No. 10963, also known as the Tax Reform for Acceleration and Inclusion (TRAIN), particularly Section 47 thereof, providing the Excise Tax on Sweetened Beverages, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised to include the new Tax Type Code XB (for Sweetened Beverages) by updating the BIR forms in the forms codes table under the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) following the procedures below:

1.       From the main menu on screen, go to "Utilities" menu or press hotkey 'U' on the keyboard.

2.       From the menu, select "Update codes table" submenu by using arrow keys to highlight the submenu then press enter or simply press hotkey 'U' on the keyboard.

3.       Another submenu option will appear; this time you select "Form" by pressing enter key since the submenu is already highlighted or simply press hotkey 'F' on the keyboard.

4.       Table will appear on screen with the key press command is on yellow color text below the screen indicate how to add/insert a new record on the list.

5.       To add new record for "2200-S," press 'Ctrl + N.'

6.       Add the form code under Form code column, description of the form on Description column, tax code under the Tax Type column, description of the tax code under the Tax Type Description column and frequency under the Frequency column.

7.       Values to be added. (Frequency column is blank for all values):

For

Original Law.Subject: Delayed Transmission of Collection Reports by Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: All Authorized Agent Banks

Details.Details:
In connection with the transmission of collection reports by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) to the Bureau of Internal Revenue's (BIR's) Revenue Data Centers (RDCs), all AABs are hereby reminded of Bank Bulletin No. 2014-17 which provide the manner of sending Batch Control Sheet (BCS) files of collection reports, through the assigned e-mail accounts, to their respective RDCs in case of difficulties in the BIR's Electronic Data Transmission facility.

Likewise, all AABs are also advised to refrain from directly furnishing the Revenue District Offices (RDOs) with copies of the daily collection reports through a Universal Serial Bus (USB) or other forms of storage unit device, and/or promptly informing the RDOs through telephone calls, in order to ensure the integrity of the collection reports.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: Full Implementation of the BCS Validation E-mail
Original Law.To: All Authorized Agent Banks

Details.Details:
In order to address the issue on the penalties of Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) arising from lack of feedback mechanism on their transmitted BCS files, this Bureau has developed the BCS Validation Electronic Mail which was initially implemented to four pilot AABs last October 2016. It provided the AABs' Head Offices with feedback on the status of their transmitted BCS files.

For the full implementation of the above-mentioned feedback mechanism, the following policies and procedures shall be strictly observed by all AABs:

1.       Recipients of the BCS Validation E-mail shall be the AABs' Head Offices which shall hand it out to their respective branches.

2.       Subject of the validation shall be in detailed format as follows:

<Bank Name> BCS File(s) processed in <Revenue Data Center> as of <Processing Date>

3.       The BCS Validation E-mail shall be in detailed format as follows:

<Agent Type> <Agent Code> <RDO Code> <Municipality Code> <Collection Date> <BCS Code> <BCS Number>

If a particular record encountered an error, the following details shall be included in the format mentioned above;

<Item No.> <Tax Type> <Collection Mode No.>

4.       Use the attached BCS Integrity Code Guide as reference to determine if a BCS number requires an action or not. Please see Annex "A".

5.       If there are additional recipients or changes in the target recipients, the AABs' Head Offices shall submit a signed hard copy of the BCS Validation E-mail Notification Request Form to the Systems Development Division (SDD). An e-mailed scan-copy will suffice. Please see Annex "B."

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

ANNEX A.details: Batch Control Sheet (BCS) Integrity Code Guide

Original Law.Subject: Installation of the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) in Microsoft Windows 7 and 10
Original Law.To: All Authorized Agent Banks

Details.Details:
In connection with the incompatibility of the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) with the upgraded version of Microsoft Windows operating system, particularly Windows 7 and 10, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised on the procedures on how to install and run the above LBDES on said versions:

For Windows 7:

1.      Download and Install Windows Virtual PC.

2.      Download and Install Windows XP Mode in Windows Virtual PC.

For Windows 10:

1.      Download and Install Oracle Virtual Manager.

2.      Install Windows XP OS in Oracle Virtual Manager.

Do not proceed if XP Mode and Virtual has not been installed in Windows 7;

Do not proceed if Oracle Virtual Manager and Windows XP has not been installed in Windows 10.

3.      Open Windows Explorer.

4.      Copy all LBDES installer files to Drive C.

5.      Click on Start, and choose Run. . .

6.      Type cmd on the command line and hit Enter.

7.      On the command prompt, type CD\ and hit Enter.

8.      Type as_ins and press Enter. Follow instructions on screen.

9.      Type edit c:\windows\system32\config.nt and hit Enter.

10.      Scroll down to the bottom of the file and add the following lines if not found or replace if found:

files = 100

buffers = 100

11.      Press ALT + F+ S to save the file.

12.      Press ALT + F + X to exit the editor.

13.      Type EXIT on the command line and hit Enter.

14.      Restart XP Mode.

15.      After restart, open Windows Explorer.

16.      Go to C:\de011 folder.

17.      Double click on CBRDE011.EXE to run LBDES.

For further queries on the above procedure, please contact Mr. Sean Neil S. Sabado of the System Development Division (SDD) through telephone numbers 9251966 and 9817090.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: Development/Enhancement of Internet Banking Facility for Tax Payments
Original Law.To: All Internal Revenue Officers and Others Concerned

Details.Details:
In the effort to provide a faster, secure, more reliable and more convenient services for the taxpayers, the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) is continuously embarking on enhancement and development of its electronic payment facilities to receive and process the daily tax collection reports of the Authorized Agent Banks (AABs).

This advisory is issued to encourage all AABs to develop/enhance their own internet banking facilities and other electronic payment channels that can accommodate tax payment transactions for the taxpaying public.

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Reiteration on the Implementation of Certain Policies in the Acceptance of Income Tax Returns during the 2017 Income Tax Filing Period

Details.Details:
As a supplement to the provisions of Bank Bulletin No. 2017-01 on the requirement for the opening of bank operations for two consecutive Saturdays immediately prior to the forthcoming April 17, 2017 tax deadline, as well as the extension of the banking hours from 3:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. from April 1 to 17, 2017, for purposes of accepting over-the-counter tax payments, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are likewise advised to comply with the provisions of Bank Bulletin No. 2016-09 with respect to the specific policies and guidelines on the acceptance of over-the-counter tax payments, particularly on all income tax returns accepted on April 1, 2017 and April 8, 2017 which shall be validated on the date of actual collection but the same shall be reported in the Batch Control Sheet (BCS) as collection for the following working day, April 3, 2017 and April 10, 2017, respectively. In connection with the extension of the banking hours, all AABs are also advised not to refuse acceptance of tax payments from taxpayers who are already within the bank's premises by the close of the said extended banking hours during the said period. HTcADC

The remittance of the tax collections and the submission of the BCS, together with the supporting income tax returns and attachments, shall be in accordance with the existing policies and procedures.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Retrieval of Tax Returns

Details.Details:
It has come to the attention of this Office that some District Offices do not regularly pick-up the Batch Control Sheet (BCS) and the copies of tax returns as well as their applicable attachments from Authorized Agent Bank (AAB) branches. In fact, there are some AAB branches that reported existence of significant number of unretrieved tax returns that are still in their possessions for more than three (3) months reckoned from the date of actual filing of these returns by concerned taxpayers with the AAB branches.

Relative to this, all AABs are hereby advised to inform this Office, thru The Chief, Collection Performance Monitoring Division, Room 804, 8th Floor, BIR National Office Building, Agham Road, Diliman, Quezon City, for the list of Revenue District Offices that failed to physically retrieve the copies of the daily BCS and the filed tax returns and attachments on a regular basis from any of your respective bank branch. For your information and guidance. EcTCAD

Original Law.Subject: Consolidation of Revenue District Office (RDO) No. 43A-East Pasig City and RDO No. 43B-West Pasig City Pursuant to Revenue Administrative Order (RAO) No. 2-2016
Original Law.To: All Authorized Agent Banks

Details.Details:
All AABs are hereby advised that RDO No. 43A-East Pasig City and RDO No. 43B-West Pasig City were consolidated into one district office as RDO No. 43-Pasig City pursuant to Revenue Administrative Order (RAO) No. 2-2016; and the said merged office is currently located at 2nd Floor Rudgen Building, Shaw Boulevard, Brgy. San Antonio, Pasig City. HTcADC

Accordingly, all concerned AABs under RDO No. 43-Pasig are hereby advised of the following procedures effective February 16, 2017:

1. All concerned AABs shall accept all tax returns/forms/declarations by taxpayers, regardless of their previous RDO classification code (RDO No. 43-A East Pasig or RDO No. 43-B West Pasig).

2. All accepted tax returns and tax collections therefrom shall be reported in the Batch Control Sheet (BCS) and in the Consolidated Report of Daily Collection (CRDC) in the following manner:

a. For tax collections beginning February 16, 2017 and thereafter, RDO Code No. 43 shall be used regardless of whether or not the RDO Number reflected in the filed tax returns/forms/declarations bears the RDO Code suffix A or B; and

b. For tax collections on February 15, 2017 and prior dates, the RDO Number must indicate the RDO suffix letters to their former RDO Codes as either RDO No. 43A or 43B.

All BCS together with the copies of the tax returns/forms/declarations as well as the supporting documents physically filed by the taxpayers with the AAB branches shall be retrieved by duly authorized retrievers from RDO No. 43-Pasig.

For your guidance and immediate compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.To: Acceptance of Tax Returns/Payments of Internal Revenue Taxes by Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) on April 1, 2017 and April 8, 2017 and Extension of Banking Hours from 3:00 P.M. to 5:00 P.M. for the Period April 1 to April 17, 2017

Details.Details:

1. xxx

2. xxx

Original Law.Subject: All Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Over-the-Counter Acceptance of Tax Returns/Payments of Internal Revenue Taxes

Details.Details:
This has reference to the unavailability of this Bureau's Electronic Filing and Payment Systems (eFPS) since December 26, 2016 for certain technical problems/issues and the subsequent issuance of a tax advisory where all eFPS taxpayers are advised to use the eBIRForms facility to file their tax returns and pay the corresponding tax dues thru over-the-counter (thru cash, checks or debit) with the concerned Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) where they are enrolled.

Considering the deadline for filing of BIR Form Nos. 2550Q, 2550M and 2551M fell on December 27, 2016, all AABs are hereby advised to accept "over-the-counter" tax payments from these returns, without the corresponding penalties for late filing until December 29, 2016, by all concerned taxpayers using either BIR official printed forms, copies of system-generated Filing Reference Number (FRN) or Tax Return Receipt Confirmation respectively generated by eFPS and eBIRForms facility, photocopies/computer generated or electronically filed tax returns.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Electronic Mail Messages from Electronic Tax Information System

Details.Details:
The Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) has piloted the processing of Consolidated Report of Daily Collection (CRDC) through its new Electronic Tax Information System (eTIS) in selected BIR offices. In your electronic transmission of the CRDC that are simultaneously processed in the old Integrated Tax System (ITS) as well as in eTIS in piloted sites, you may be receiving electronic mail (email) messages to the effect that the CRDC files you sent to the BIR were rejected by the eTIS user, even if the same files have been accepted by the ITS.

In the meantime that the BIR is still in the process of verifying the reasons for such rejections in the eTIS, thru its email address at etis@bir.gov.ph, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are hereby advised to temporarily disregard the email notifications on such rejections from eTIS until such time that a new bank bulletin is issued by this Bureau for that purpose.

However, all AABs are hereby reminded that all email notifications on CRDC file rejections by ITS, thru the email address barcadm@bir-cdf.bir.gov.ph, shall be immediately addressed by the concerned AABs and that the corrected CRDC files be resent to the same email address of the BIR for uploading to the ITS. HESIcT

For your information and guidance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Encoding of Correct Tax Type to the Limited Bank Data Entry System

Details.Details:
It has been observed that there are some Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) that are encoding invalid tax and form types in the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES) resulting to the non-uploading of collection reports to this Bureau's internal systems.

In view thereof, and in order to ensure that the correct tax and form types are properly encoded in the LBDES, all AABs are hereby advised to update the BIR forms in the forms codes table under the LBDES following the procedures below: HTcADC

1. Request a soft copy of FORM.DBF file from the Systems Development Division (SDD) through email address at sdd_isdos@bir.gov.ph.

2. Save the soft copy of FORM.DBF in the Desktop. It shall be ensured that the LBDES is closed before saving the copy of the said file.

3. Copy the FORM.DBF file to C:\de011\DATA folder and click "Yes" when asked to overwrite the file.

4. Open the Utilities -> Update Codes Table -> Forms in LBDES to check the updated list of forms that were loaded in the LBDES.

For any further queries on the above procedures you may contact Mr. Sean Neil S. Sabado of this Bureau's SDD through telephone numbers 925-1966 or 981-7090.

All AABs are also reminded that, for corporate income tax returns (i.e., BIR Form Nos. 1702RT, 1702EX, and 1702MX) received from the concerned taxpayers, only the form type 1702 shall be selected/encoded in the list of forms in the LBDES, the suffixes "RT," "EX" and "MX" must be disregarded.

All AABs are further reminded to refrain from adding/deleting or changing forms in the form codes table in the LBDES without the corresponding BIR bank advisory.

For your information and guidance. CAIHTE

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Maintenance of Minimum Amount of Bank Deposit Account in Tax Payments for Electronic Filing and Payment System

Details.Details:
It has come to the attention of this Office that, despite the express prohibition prescribed under the provisions of previously issued Bank Bulletin Nos. 2010-14 and 2011-33, there are still reports/complaints from concerned taxpayers who are being required by certain Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) to maintain a minimum deposit, or even in excess of the minimum amount for regular deposit account, for bank accounts dedicated in the payment of taxes thru the Electronic Filing and Payment System (eFPS).

In view thereof, it is hereby advised that such continuing practice by AABs should be immediately discontinued and the same should not be committed in the future, considering that the same is in violation of the said previously issued Bank Bulletins, as well as the objective of this Bureau to provide the taxpaying public utmost convenience in the payment of their taxes.

For your guidance and strict compliance.

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Timely Transmission of Accurate Tax Payment Details

Details.Details:
In line with the current administration's thrust for a more expeditious delivery of public service by all government agencies, this Bureau is streamlining the processes in the issuance of certificates/clearances relative to the applications filed by all concerned taxpayers requiring prior validation by this Bureau of taxes paid by these taxpayers-applicants.

To ensure that all taxes collected from taxpayers are readily available for viewing in the Bureau's Integrated Tax System/Electronic Tax Information System (ITS/eTIS) so that the same can be used for validation/verification by all concerned revenue district offices, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) shall strictly comply with their obligations on the timely transmission of collection reports prescribed under the provisions of their respective Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) with the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) and Bureau of the Treasury (BTr), as implemented by the existing revenue issuances.

By way of reiteration, all tax payment details contained in the daily Batch Control Sheets (BCS) shall be transmitted, through email or the Electronic Data Transmission System (EDTS), to the concerned BIR Data Centers within forty eight (48) hours from receipt of tax payments made by the taxpayers, pursuant to the provisions of Revenue Memorandum Order No. 11-2008. Moreover, the electronic Consolidated Report of Daily Collection (CRDC) shall be transmitted to this Bureau, thru email, by the AAB-Head Offices at its email address ecrdc@bir.gov.ph, within five (5) days from the date of receipt of tax collections, pursuant to the same provisions of the MOA. Accordingly, in cases where issues and concerns on the timely transmission of accurate tax payment details shall arise, the immediate resolution thereof shall be given utmost priority, preferably within the day when such issues are raised to the AAB's attention by the concerned revenue offices.

In case of failure to comply with the foregoing provisions of this Bulletin, the imposition of the applicable penalties and/or sanctions prescribed under existing laws and implementing rules and regulations shall be strictly enforced by this Bureau.

For your guidance and strict compliance. CAIHTE

(SGD.) CAESAR R. DULAY
Commissioner of Internal Revenue

Original Law.Subject: All BIR Authorized Agent Banks
Original Law.To: Electronic Submission of the Dishonored Check Details in Comma Separated Value Format and the Encoding of Payments Details in the Limited Bank Data Entry System (LBDES)

Details.Details:
In Bank Bulletin No. 2012-03 dated January 24, 2012, all Authorized Agent Banks (AABs) are required to electronically submit the Dishonored Check (DC) details in Comma Separated Value (CSV) format. In connection thereto and in order to ensure proper reporting of the DC details to the Bureau's Electronic Tax Information System (eTIS), all AABs are hereby advised to use the reasons for dishonored checks listed in Annex "A" hereof in preparing the said required CSV format for the electronic submission of DC details.

Likewise, with the implementation of the splitting of some Revenue District Offices (RDOs), it has been observed that there are some AABs that continue to use the old RDO Codes for encoding in the LDBES. This practice was identified as one of the reasons for the non-uploading of AAB collection reports to the Bureau's Integrated Tax System (ITS)/eTIS. HEITAD

In view thereof, all AABs are hereby advised to use the updated RDO Codes for the following RDOs in the encoding of payment details in the LBDES so that the collection reports can be uploaded to the ITS/eTIS:

It is further advised, that the AABs may request for the latest installer from our Revenue Data Centers for the updated version of the LBDES.

For your information and guidance. aDSIHc

(SGD.) KIM S. JACINTO-HENARES
Commissioner of Internal Revenue
